description:
I was pleasantly surprised by my first visit here. I agree with another reviewer here who says it's not a snobby wine bar--many of them in SF are, so it was really nice to hang out in a down-to-earth atmosphere. We were there between 5:30-7:30 on a Friday night and it was quiet enough to have nice conversation without being deathly silent. The place was nicely decorated, very homey. They had a decent selection of wines and we were given good advice on what to pick. I also had the mixed green salad and hummus/avocado bruschetta and was very satisfied with both. 

I will definitely be coming back!
author: Melissa M.

description:
Great venue for a laid back, casual gathering of friends. They have the perfect table for a large group of 10-12 people. It was easy to make a reservation too.

The food was delicious. Had the cauliflower, brussel sprouts, avocado and hummus bruschetta, and hummus and pita bread. All of them were amazing. The veggies were perfectly seasoned. The bruschetta came with 4 pieces that could be cut in half for extra sharing. The pita bread that came with the hummus was soft and fresh.

I docked a star for the service. Our server/bartender this particular evening started off by telling me that it would be better if each person came up to the bar to order individually since we were going to go separate tabs. Okay, I said, no problem at all. Then he proceeded to tell me that because he has to walk ALL the way around the bar it would really help him out and save him some time and energy. Plus, he said, if it gets really busy he just won't have time to take our order. Okay dude, it's all good... Don't stress when your shift has just started. (There literally were 2 other people at the bar who already had their drinks.) I told him I'll let my group know. Even after I informed them he made a point to tell them again.

I asked him for some lemon for the water. He came back to tell me they don't have wedges, just juice. "So, uh, you'll be okay going without right?" he asked. Then he walked away.

When I went to pay the bill, he told me some more about how much walking he has to do for his job. This place isn't that big. I totally understand that he's operating as both bartender and server and that it could get hairy if it were really busy. (Btw, the same 2 people were at the bar and just 2 other women at another table the entire time.) All the other tables were empty. I had no problem going up to the bar to order, but please save me the sob story about how busy and stressful your job is. A cheerful smile and friendly service goes much farther.
author: Susan G.

description:
Down-to-Earth wine bar in the Inner Richmond. I really like the relaxed atmosphere here and especially on an early weekday afternoon this place is very enjoyable...after all, we should all be meeting our friends for a glass of wine and a good chat at 4pm more often!

I haven't tried their foods yet, but looking at the reviews, I should totally do that next time.
author: Uli B.

description:
A decent neighborhood wine bar with a decent array of sparklings, whites, and reds spanning the globe and a number of varietals. They also have a decent number of beers on tap, as well as a larger selection of bottles of wine to choose from. The prices here are restaurant-level, but at least you have the opportunity to try things by the glass here before committing to a full bottle on site or seeking it out on your own.

In addition to the libations, they also have a modest food selection. There are salumi and cheese platters as well as flatbreads and bruschette. Service skews more towards regulars while Asian-American newbies like myself got a bit of a cold shoulder. Nevertheless, an OK place like many here in the West Bay.
author: Vincent L.

description: Such a cool place. It was really the highlight of our night in San Fran. The server was great and the ambience was eclectic. Exactly what we wanted. Great, quaint little joint - make sure you go. Minus 1 for screwing up my bill twice.
author: Deb G.

description: I didn't think the offerings were incredible, but internos has a decent selection of wine and food. It's definitely a little quieter and slower, but I enjoyed the atmosphere. The waitress who served my friend and I was not very knowledgeable when asked about the wines, but that didn't bother me much as I will drink about anything.
author: Alice L.

description:
A small neighborhood wine bar with pretty decent food.

* * * EXPERIENCE * * *
Went on a Friday night around 7ish. The interior was pretty dark. There was only one staff on duty who's helpful introducing us to the menu. Because of the whole ambient and I guess also because it's a wine bar, it's not very noisy making it a pretty suitable place for a date night.

* * * FOOD * * *
Brussels Sprouts and Corns: A-
I like that it wasn't too oily or salty. I could still taste the freshness of the Brussels Sprouts. The portion was perfect for two people.

Margherita Flatbread: B+
Nothing surprising but it tasted pretty good. I ate something before dinner already, the flatbread was perfect as the crust was very thin and cheese smelled really nice.

Since it's a wine bar, I will also give some brief notes about the wine there. They do half glass here, so my friend and I each ordered two half glasses of white + two half glasses of red. For all the four whites they tasted pretty good, with interesting + a bit complex flavor and good finish. But we were both pretty disappointed on the reds... imagine all four fell short to our expectation, we think the chances for that would be low but indeed that was true. Perhaps they change menu once in a while and we were just unlucky to get some mediocre red selection, but I would definitely suggest to go for the whites and skip the reds.

Overall I like this place especially its ambience, I live close by so I will perhaps come back often!
author: Simon C.

description:
Very good spot! 

Think we may have gotten lucky on a Saturday evening with how low key it was but would likely still enjoy it even when much busier.

Cute spot
Lots of seating
Good service
Good wine options
Really enjoyed the tomato-less bruschetta (bread with hummus, avocado, and cucumber)

Check it out!
author: Rachel R.

description:
It was odd stepping into this hole in the wall wine joint - it felt like I was back in SoMa or FiDi based on the interior but here we were, all the way out on Geary.

We sat at the bar after going to Hong Kong II for dinner, just so that we could get a closing glass of wine. The bartender was friendly and helped recommend the best choices for us. Prices were a little on the pricier end for what I expected all the way out on Geary but very typical SF. Ambiance was great, a little dim, pretty quiet and apparently dog friendly since there was the most adorable pup sitting at the bar.
author: Leina K.

description:
Despite posting hours on Friday and Saturday until 1am, twice now we've tried to go at 10pm, once turned away with other people in the place, and tonight doors locked but someone behind the bar.  I guess they just want to cater to day-drinkers. 
This place is local for us, and until these two visits recently we have enjoyed it. If the hours are changing, the website should really be updated.
author: Jane E.

description: We popped in around 6:30pm on a Friday night, and had a pleasant time!  Good wine, great service (we appreciated the fact they allow you to sample a wine before ordering a full glass), and a classy, elegant, not-too-loud atmosphere.
author: Barnali D.

description:
Has to be my favorite wine spot in the city. Very relaxed and unassuming - furthest thing from a snobby wine bar - not stuffy - but still classy. 

I tried two wines that were a bit too heavy for me and felt a little guilty asking to try another so I ordered the Pinot Noir - the bartender still poured me a small taste of it before pouring the glass (after I told her I liked it) - I appreciate that a lot!! 

The goat cheese bruschetta with balsamic drizzle was the perfect late afternoon snack. Will be back.
author: Christopher K.

description: Really really bummed on this spot tonight. It's been a few months since I've made a visit but this visit will be my last. Poor service and terrible food it's not worth the visit. The flat bread pizza was cold and flavorless which paired perfect with the cold and absent bartender (The girl with the short brown hair) This place use to be amazing! What happened? 3 stars are for the wine.
author: Michele G.

description:
Do not come here. The bar tender with dark brown hair (short hair) is really extremely rude. We went here and wanted food and wine. First we sat at the bar for 10 minutes waiting for the only bartender here to stop her conversation and ask us if we wanted anything. 

Finally she was done. I didn't drink at all yet and she wouldn't even let us order alcohol because she decided arbitrarily that we were drunk. 

I have never felt so offended in my life by someone. I will NEVER come back. The bartender ruined it. She's really rude.
author: Lori R.

description:
I came here on a Wednesday night, accidnentally. I was waiting to meet up with friends for dinner and thought I would spend some time getting work done while I wait for them to arrive.

The place was busy but not too crowded. Someone brought their dog in (dog-friendly here). One large TV streaming a Warrior's game. They had wifi (password available on request), which was perfect because this wine bar served as a coffee-shop (but better) for me. 

There were about 5-10 red and white wines to choose from, prices ranged from $13+ for a glass. Excellent ambiance, an above-average wine list, and professional (not annoying) service. 

Overall, I will be back.
author: Nicole J.

description:
This is a great find! 

You know those pretentious wine bars with their snooty winos? Ya, that's not this place.
Internos is super chill and laid back, the staff is friendly and informative, and they have a good selection of wine.
author: Mandi W.

description:
This a hole in-the-wall spot that you shouldn't miss out on: 

Intimate--great atmosphere for small groups! 
Friendly and attentive service! 
My friend and I enjoyed everything we ordered from the red wine, margherita flat bread, avo hummus cucumber bruschetta, and salad. 

It's a little on the pricier end, but you get your moneys worth in quality.
author: Elyssa C.

description: There is always a great selection of wine and the staff always do a wonderful job with recommendations and are super friendly. The atmosphere is very welcoming, fun, and "neighborhoody". The food menu is relatively small, but they have a really good selection of meats and cheeses, among other things.
author: Tom H.

description:
While waiting for dinner across the street, Internos was the a savior, the no-pretentiousness local wine bar to get a quick glass of wine (okay, 2) and some olives & mixed nuts.

Great wine and beer options from mid-to-higher range, with reasonable prices to match. The olives were my favorite, though the nuts were almost a burnt pistachio style -- unexpected and only okay.

Ambiance is key at any wine bar and Internos did it well. It wasn't overly fancy (the man next to us, for instance, was working off his laptop at the bar) but it had a vibe that made you feel comfortable in more casual dress.

Definitely swing thru this local wine bar before your next ramen craving.
author: Rachel H.

description:
This place is a good, relaxed, unpretentious wine bar, perfect right before or after dinner. Came here on Sunday around 5pm with two friends, we were the only ones in here for a bit. Server was attentive but not overly so; friendly and professional. I would love to make this a go-to place, though it is a bit out of my way. Would love to return and share this place with more friends.

By the end of our stay, bar had more people but never became crowded. I love that the place feels very clean, you don't have to yell to be heard, and prices are reasonable. Bar menu looked kind of meh but the complimentary nuts and olives were delish.
author: Melissa T.

description: This a great neighborhood spot. There is a nice selection of wines by the glass and the hummus and pita we had was flavorful and good size. Also, the bartender was very friendly.
author: Mira R.

description: It's a chill upscale wine bar without the high upscale wine bar prices.  Pizza is on point and ambiance is good for a meet up or a moment of self reflection.
author: Natasha B.

description:
Came in on a Saturday afternoon and was warmly greeted by Ioana. Her friendly demeanor made my experience here wonderful. She was patient to teach me about the wine I was drinking!

This place is adorable. Quiet mellow vibe with great music. Definitely my new fave.
author: Tina L.

description: The brunette is awesome!  Love the vibe, ambiance and welcoming atmosphere.  Couldn't ask for more on a weeknight happy hour!  Oh and all of the flatbreads are scrumptious.
author: Kathleen L.

description:
How have I not reviewed this yet? Best local wine bar in Inner Richmond. I come here with giant groups for my birthday, and often times by myself to have a glass of wine and indulge in a flatbread pizza by myself. I always meet lovely new people and make friends.

Everyone who works here is awesome, friendly, and wine knowledgeable. Prosciutto flatbread with arugula is my fav. They have a TV, so nice if there is a game on. Will always come back!
author: Gina R.

description: It's definitely different! Who knew wine cafes even existed? Open seating and it can get crowded when there's a game going on but the waiter does his/her best to attend to everyone. Asking for a recommendation with a general knowledge of what you like really helps.
author: Carol T.

description:
Love this gem down in the avenues!

Easily one of the best wine bars I've been to. For a nice, chill evening out with your significant other or a small group of friends - this is the place to check out. 

I don't need a wide array of wine selections (and the ones here are very good selections), and the bartender was great. She was kind and attentive. My third or fourth time here, and I'll definitely be back. I don't get some of the awful reviews; if anything, I must have been in great company every time! Cheers!
author: Naomi P.

description: RUDE! The lady (with short, dark brown hair--same lady another reviewer mentioned) was unfriendly, inattentive, and could benefit from learning how to smile. As she was checking me and my friends' IDs, she seemed to accuse me of using a fake ID?!! I may look young, but girl please I am way past the fake ID days. It was insulting to say the least (I think her exact words were "Oh, I must have imagined I've seen this ID before..."), and set the tone for the evening. I love the ambiance of this wine bar, but her attitude left a sour taste in my mouth. Plus, the wine is SO EXPENSIVE. Average cost for a glass is $16...and let me repeat, average. There were glasses for well over $20. My friend said she had a great time the first time she went here---it seems like she was served by Adnan (she said he was really knowledgable about the wines, and offered taste tests). Unfortunately, I won't be returning because of the inconsistent service.
author: Diane G.

description:
******************************* 964 *******************************

      Internos Wine Cafe is a casual neighborhood wine bar, small with high tables, and a long bar, plenty options for wines by the glass, and small plates such as cheese, charcuterie, some flatbread and roasted veggetables.

     Reasonable price point, and always friendly service. It's a good spot for date night.
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
Love this place! We went on a weekday evening and the place wasn't too crowded. I love the decor. Understated but classy. I just love seeing all those bottles of wine arranged on the walls. :) 
The lady at the bar was very helpful with explaining wines and giving us tips. We ordered a flatbread which was okay, nothing great. 
I would definitely come back here.
author: Seema K.

description:
This is a hidden gem and those gems are few and far between on Geary (unfortunately.  I want to like Geary but its so busy and strip mall ubiquitous).  Internos is becoming my go to place because it is on my way home, parking is ample as well as being on the 38 muni, and amazingly, they always seem to have space or make space.  (the last two are so rare these days!)

About Internos, its lighting is wonderfully flattering and the bar is beautiful marble (if memory serves).  I generally prefer to have a chair back so I find the bar here more comfortable than the tables (which have cute wooden chairs - no back).   

The wine list is interesting wines here and the prices are reasonable.   I'd like to speak with the buyer to get his/her methodology because its not a common list but its bound to please just about any wine lover.   The bar bites are fine - I'm not sure if they have a full kitchen but the menu is limited to bites (bruschetta, flat breads, ...).  We have had the meat plate and the bruschettas look good.   Just don't go in thinking there is a full dinner menu available.   

I have never had bad service here.   Frankly, I really appreciate the effort.   Opening a warm and relevant space on Geary is a risky endeavor.   Somehow they have managed to create an upper scale spot that still feels neighboorhoodie and accessible for a couple glasses of wine or a refuge from busy, zooming, Geary.   I appreciate it and will be back.
author: Lynn P.

description: Great hidden gem in Laurel Heights! This place is 2 blocks from my apartment which is super convenient, and has great wine, beer and food (I didn't eat food but it looked good). The atmosphere and ambiance is great, and there was a great selection of wine. The bartender was really knowledgable, and let us try wines when we weren't sure what we wanted. I will definitely be coming here again.
author: Jenna G.

description: I agree with Dukes of Frisco.  The bartender had absolutely no social skills, made limited eye contact, and had no sense of customer service.  When I left the restaurant, I reached for the candy jar and she grilled me as if I was stealing the Jewels of England.  If you're a person of color, I strongly encourage you to stay away!  People here need a course on cultural sensitivity.  (The saddest thing about this review is I think she was partially a woman of color) what a shame.
author: Anh H.

description:
Unpretentious, friendly, and knowledgeable.  I like it here.  

First time we went in, there were two dogs in there.  So next time I brought my lab with me.  They are cool about it.  

The staff seems to know their wine.

The food is tasty.

And on Mondays they have half price bottles.  Can't beat that.

Prices are a little high, but hey, they have to make a profit in SF so I can't complain.  Have been there several times and I will go back.
author: Jeff H.

description: Flatbread is worth five stars.  Minus two stars for the service. Wine was good,  but what I wanted off the list was still sold out.  We only got two of the three food items we ordered. She forgot my sister's second glass of wine so she ended up drinking half of mine.  We would have stayed and ordered more,  but figured it was time to go.
author: Jules M.

description: This is my favorite wine bar in the city! Only wished I lived closer (and wish there were some gluten free flatbread options on the menu)!
author: l c.

description: Great staff, great selections! Did I mention great staff? Always a fun night I just wish they'd open on Sunday's- I needs me my motivation for Monday's!!
author: Meredith G.

description:
Been meaning to check out this wine bar in my hood that I pass by on the bus everyday. Finally got a chance to check it out on a Monday night, there were only two other parties plus some folks sitting at the bar.

Perfectly laid back, chill vibe.  Nothing pretentious or snobby. Extensive wine list with a variety of beers and also bites to munch on. 

Great spot for a chill relaxing weeknight!
author: Wendy Z.

description: Nice neighborhood hang out.  The wine selection was limited however the bartender suggested a good wine.  Appetizers are limited and expensive.  The bartender was extremely nice.  Will be back.
author: Susan J.

description:
Pros: nice decor, good food, nice staff

Cons: crazy small pours (clearly measuring or an overlord watching every drop) lucky to find a glass of wine under $13 (in fairness there were 3 on the menu- all white), which I just don't understand given how much good, cheap wine there is in the world- you still get to mark it up 30%!
author: Jenny K.

description: I had an amazing experience with my best friend , great portions , nice server , great food , great drinks . Food came out fast . Try the avocado and hummus bruschetta  . Will definitely come back .
author: Andres L.

description: Came here today for a drink and a quick bite! The lady who greeted us was fake and not interested in being a good host~ the entire time we were there all she did was text on her ph wtf!!! The flatbread pizza was way too salty. I will not be coming back!!!
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description:
I probably shouldn't even be writing a review until I've properly enjoyed it to its fullest, but I'll write an update later.   

I've only been here once-- so far.  I will be back.   Wine is good, prices are fine.  They give you a bottle of water with glasses, of course, and a plate of olives at the table, which are delicious, and they will ask you if you;d like more if you finish them.  

Next time I'll make sure to have dinner or at least appetizers.  The place is nice, clean, pleasant atmosphere.  Staff was friendly and attentive.    We just didn't have a lot of time that evening, so it was a glass of wine for us and that was all.  Next time I will savor the place more.
author: Lori B.

description: I was looking forward to finding a wine spot to come after work. I was honesty not pleased with the customer service. The lady was cold and never checked with us. We were thinking of ordering another round, but felt we could go elsewhere. It's such a beautiful place but the "checked out" lady, just didn't make us want to hang out there.
author: Lulu R.

description:
You wouldn't think much based on the location along Geary Ave but really great atmosphere, good wine and yummy menu
Bruschetta always my favorite
author: Gabriele P.

description: A mellow lil wine bar.  Nice selection, friendly staff, good food. Not pretentious.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Stealing time.

As good as ever: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9hHLXjOK1-0

As long a wait as ever: http://www.yelp.com/biz/burma-superstar-san-francisco-2?hrid=LI-IyNiD-edWcLx5oTMkiQ

Fortunately Internos was a short walk away. Nothing kills time like excellent avocado, cucumber and hummus bruchetta and Brussels sprouts roasted with lemon juice.

Crowded but one of the friendly staff members spotted us two bar seats. Glass of wine from their extensive and reasonably priced list ($8 - $12) sped things up further.

Good conversation also helps with waiting. Both with my companion and the couple next to us who were plotting a trip to Iceland. A very good decision indeed.

Steal time here.
author: Jason B.

description: I really like this spot but things could be quiet here given that Geary gets no traffic. My friend and I shared a cheese plate ( the parmagiano was fantastic). And wine by the glass was solid.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Hosted a gathering here a few years ago and it was so disappointing.  They'd recently opened and we were excited to support a neighborhood business and in fact were excited to get our friends over to see it so we decided to host our co-Ed adults only baby shower there. We gave them a guaranteed minimum, we offered to buy out the bar which they denied, so we moved the event to an earlier time to work with them. We pre-ordered food and wine for approximately 60 people spending literally thousands of dollars. The owner was extremely rude not only to us but to our guests. I was 8 months pregnant and really didn't appreciate when it was time for our party to wrap up the owner coming to me and saying literally "get out."  This was at 8pm by the way. I will never understand why he wanted to empty the place out that early. I know we brought his sleepy little wine bar a lot of business and exposure that day, way more than they see on a typical Saturday night. I have seen this man, wife and his new child walking around the neighborhood since I live nearby too. What a total jerk. Was hopeful this place was going to be our neighborhood spot but it was not meant to be. Life is long and I have never been back. Walk by it every day but will never give this guy another cent. Hopefully he has learned to hire friendly staff and stay away from his customers!!
author: Andrea R.

description:
Came here late Saturday night because from the yelp pictures it seemed like a low key, chill spot...and that's exactly what it was.  

The ambiance was very laid back, dimly lit, filled with people just enjoying their friend(s) company and the wine/beer.  No annoying-wannabe-profound music playing in the background and no one being obnoxious and loud.

Service was great and they were cool with my friend changing their drink after they decided it wasn't their cup of tea after tasting it.  

I will definitely come back here just to unwind after a day of touring & shopping.
author: Priscilla C.

description: Had a great meeting here the other night. Great wine selection and decent food, good beers on tap too. A little gem a fairly desolate part of the Richmond.
author: Michael G.

description:
Not really a fan of wine so I'll be reviewing the place itself instead. This place will be great for wine lovers because they offer a wide selection, plus they have some yummy appetizers. You can social with some friends comfortably with some small bites and a glass in hand. The place is very dimly lit with some interesting light fixtures, and filled with some modern decor. Lots of black and white photo canvas on the wall, it seems like they are really into art. The whole place is painted in dark color so it gives off the intimate and relaxing atmosphere. I like how it's not crowded at all, so you can have a nice conversation without screaming over the music.

The server was also very friendly, and made some good suggestions when asked about what to drink. They only serve wine and beer so don't come here if you're planning to pound some shots, this is not that kind of place.
author: Elaine Y.

description: I will never return to this wine bar if that woman is working again. She seemed nice at first but then became increasingly icy as we stayed, drank, tipped, and were overcharged without our consent.  she turned off the music and acted as though we were supposed to leave at 10:30 pm even though listed hours stated closing time at 1am. An odd experience since I really like this place and would return otherwise. Not sure what was up with her.
author: Mackenzie O.

description:
I will forever be grateful to one of the lovely bartenders at this wine bar because they introduced me to what may quite possibly be the best wine I've ever tasted! (Okay, I'm 22, so my repertoire isn't that huge, but anyways...)

Copain Les Voisins Pinot Noir. Oh my word. At $7.50 for a half glass, and $15 for a full glass, it was the pricier pick from the pinot list. However, the gal waiting on us recommended it when my group was deciding on what to get for round #2.

It was absolutely divine. I only had a half glass and wish I'd splurged on a full one. I thought about that wine for at least two days afterwards, and made plans the following week to come back and order it again. Unfortunately, they sold out of it really fast. You can't really find it anywhere except directly from the winemaker.

I do have to say that if you're a college student and don't have an appreciation for wine, you may find the menu to be a tad pricey. Glasses are $9-12 on average, I'd say. However, they have a really eclectic selection with wines from all around the world. I saw lots of picks from Spain, Italy, Argentina and Chile. 

Their menu is nice as well. On our second visit, we ordered the charcuterie plate, which came with a really nice salad on the side. For $13, it was well worth it. 

I've since moved across the bay, but I will definitely be back!
author: Ellen M.

description:
Great place. Very good food and wine selections! Nice decor, nice atmosphere, good service.

Wish they would take over the empty place next to their Wine Bar. More tables, room would be great -- to have bigger groups and not have to wait for a table sometimes.

A couple of outside tables with heat lamps would also be something so many people would like -- to sit outside and enjoy our wine and cheese!
author: John G.

description:
Came here once on a Friday night. They have a fair selection of cheeses and a good selection on meats.

The servers were business, sufficiently attentive for the flow.

Not the most quiet place; would be good to catch up with a friend here but not necessarily a first date.
author: Tammy H.

description: Wonderful! Came here last Friday with a friend and had a great exerience. Our server was so friendly and helpful. He suggested a Pinot Grigio, that we both loved, and the Prosciutto flatbread is delish! We will definitely be coming back soon :)
author: Sarah S.

description: Terrible service. We spent well over $150 at this place. The least they could do was refill our waters and bring the check. Too bad gratuity was included...
author: Morgan M.

description:
All I had to drink here was water while I watched my friends get their drink on.  I'm a responsible preggo lady so of course I wouldn't poison my fetus with an alcholic beverage :)

I'm giving this place 4 stars because the service was great...nothing pretenious or snooty about them here.  Our server was friendly, gave great recommendations and always had a smile on her face.

Great relaxing atmosphere, nice dim lights but not too dim where you can't see in front of you.  Great tunes and the clientele there seems cool too.

After the baby I will definitely be back for a glass of wine or 5!
author: Amy L.

description:
Adnan, Quinn...where are you?  Mom & Pop this place is not, but you were part of the charm I love(d) about Internos...can we get a night or am I missing it?
I love Internos!  It seems every time I go it's because I've just started, ended or am about to begin a new job.  LMAO!  So, it's been about every year since 2009 and the same year they opened, which is the funny and not so funny part.  Truthfully, I've been many times to catch up with friends, celebrate other occasions and last night I was there on a date.  Internos is perfect for a date with several comfortable four tops...easily made into a two top...leaving plenty of room for wine, beer and these amazing flatbread(s), olives, pistachio nuts and other items like bruschetta (4+ kinds if I recall) and a take on a classic Caprese salad that's just delicious.  
I love the fact this place has made it in San Francisco! It was no easy task for Adnan, his wife Quinn and their chocolate lab puppy,  Moose (? - can't be sure), who would sleep behind the bar.  I heard many stories and watched; they were clearly ready to open, but didn't and then when they did I watched them grow and grow and grow.  What an honor.  Adnan ran around offering spills of an exciting new red he'd brought in from some near or distant place.  Quinn tended bar, which made it fun to sit and enjoy watching as they worked together to make it happen...their trusted pup sleeping nearby.  
I hate it things cannot stay the same and this is a totally selfish review only because I'm about to be in a similar boat.  Do you dedicate every night of your life to a restaurant?  Or do you find the right employees to dedicate their lives? Or do you partner with several, extremely talented people who can share and separate responsibility, offer excellent hospitality and go above and beyond...offering spills of new wines and sending out complimentary olives and nuts (which are priced on the menu)?  I know it's a question every restauranteur asks during their infancy and well into the teenage years I'm sure.  What's the answer?
Please, I miss you guys and what your presence brought to Internos.  The place just isn't the same and i actually had to read the wine list last night instead of asking Adnan a bunch of questions, checking out the food and saying "okay, whatever you'd like Adnan."  That was service and hospitality and I loved it.  
The last time, which I did not review, the bar and service staff clearly needed supervision and training.  This seems to be taken care of as of last night, but there were still multiple times I had to ask a busser/runner for our server or get up and get her myself.  It's not as bad as Plough & Stars, but not a fair compare!  The service wasn't bad...it just wasn't great.  When we did get the attention it was prompt and thorough.  So, if nothing else this is just a "we can do better, right!" email.  I accepted the wine recommended. My date had a couple of Belgian beers, in a matching Belgian label beer glass that was cold with one beer poured at the bar and one poured at the table.  Would y'all tell the nice young lady it's 'cold glass on the table, cold beer poured into it (to show off that it is a cold glass and the beer matches the labeled glass) then a NEW cold glass, the 2nd beer bottle with the same service method?!  To a lot of people it doesn't matter, but it really does.  Someone will say...oh, c'mon...nobody notices that shit.  But, we do...especially the people in Laurel Heights, Presidio Heights and the Inner Richmond. If the service isn't spot on I hate to think what will happen to business because the food can be mediocre, the wine list can continue to grow, but if the service is sub-par guests will not return.  It's not okay to not say anything, so I'm just sayin'...the server needs a little training or a reminder course real quick to hone those skills that separate a fine establishment from a plain establishment.
The food was great...flavorful, exactly as described in the menu, presented well and it wasn't over-developed.  The food service, mainly supported by a back waiter and/or busser (I think) or maybe it was the a busser and food runner, I don't know..I wasn't paying attention.  Ha! He was great and was present when we needed something else, if we were ready for our plates to be cleared and he cleared glasses without asking anything.  He saw we had full glasses of water, beer and wine on the table so he took the empties without a word.  That's intuitive thinking and that's quality.  I have to give the credit to the Hispanic gentleman in the dark shirt.  He really was present (like when Adnan and Quinn were present) is all parts of the package last night.  Nice job, kid.
I'm not gonna harp.  I've said enough.  I hope you guys are having babies, living on a beach somewhere or in that second, beautiful Laurel Heights apartment you told me about. I hope the business is doing well.  We'll be back.  I hope you will.  We got spoiled.  I like spoiled.  Cheers!!
author: Sean M.

description:
Great wine bar. I had an Outer Richmond evening recently which included dinner at Morph, ice cream at Joe's, and finished with a drink at Internos Wine Cafe. It was the perfect end to an evening with friends. Internos is understatedly sophisticated and cozy. We chose to sit at the bar, which had comfortable seats (with backs!) over sharing the rustic long table in the center of the bar with another group. (We also glanced enviously over at the group sitting in a comfortable looking leather couch in the window). 

I'm no wine connoisseur--I can safely differentiate between red and white, but that's about it--but, for what it's worth, I was impressed by the selection. Since my drinking tastes (and tolerance) are pretty much that of a sixteen year old girl, I was pleased with the dessert wine list. I had a lovely sweet rose and then a complimentary glass of really excellent sherry given to me by the owner. Love that guy--extra star! My more wine knowledgeable friends also enjoyed their wine. 

Overall, a great  neighborhood wine bar. The dog napping behind the bar adds to the cozy, neighborhood feel.
author: Susan S.

description:
Relaxed, low-lit, friendly, and maybe even a bit sexy, Internos made for a great Friday night for a friend and myself.  

Surprisingly uncrowded and inviting, the noise level wasn't too high and that made it perfect for my friend and I to chat while we imbibed.  A gentleman who introduced himself as Adnan greeted us as we sat down on the couch and helped us pick our glasses of wine by offering very helpful answers to our questions about various selections.  He also brought us complimentary pistachios and olives to munch on with our drinks...very thoughtful and cool, although I'm allergic to pistachios and can't stand olives!!  Luckily, my friend is a fan of both :)

I noted that the per-glass prices of wines were very reasonable by current San Francisco wine-bar standards.  

And one detail sets Internos apart from other such bars I've been to as VERY cool:  they offer half-glasses of wines for exactly half the price of a full glass!  That's fantastic for those of us who want to try multiple wines without getting too drunk to drive home, or who want a little bit more after we finish a glass, but don't think we could handle another full pour.  Every wine bar should have this option!!!

While we didn't order any food, they DO offer it, and I noticed from another table nearby that the portions are quite healthy.  That's nice, because so often I go to wine bars and they offer a rather measely portion for a lot of money.  For me, I don't want to drink on an empty stomach, and I think it's ridiculous to pay $15 for a tiny sliver of cheese with two crackers.  That doesn't seem to be the problem at Internos, another big points winner in my book!

No one bothered us or badgered us to order more than what we wanted, and no one pressured us with a bill until we were ready to pay and take our leave.  Very classy.  Good service is hard to find sometimes in San Francisco, but Internos definitely provides it!!

I will definitely go back here and bring more friends.  It was a lovely experience and one I would happily repeat!!!
author: Amy L.

description:
I'm always on the look out for a good wine bar. One fine day while riding the scary 38, I took my gaze off the crazies and looked out the window to see a tiny wine bar tucked in on Geary Street. A few days later my date and I tried it. 

It's a nice cozy neighborhood spot and wasn't too crowded or loud at the time. I had a sexy & bold Malbec and the waitress suggested cheeses that would pair nicely with our wine selections. Our waitress was very helpful and seemed to actually enjoy making recommendations - huge plus!

I've since been back with my friends and enjoyed an equally great evening!
author: Leanne S.

description: They're a solid wine bar, with a decent selection of food. The wine is great, and even though the menu is limited, it's pretty damn delicious. There's plenty or seating, and even though the place is small, it feels bigger than it is. The staff is also very friendly and attentive.
author: Katia T.

description:
I like wine. I like wine bars. Only thing I like better than wine and wine bars is delicious wine consumed with lovely people in unpretentious wine bars within walking distance of my house. Hello Internos Wine Cafe. The first time I stumbled in here, I actually walked right past it. I was meeting a friend. She mentioned it was a little difficult to find and it was. There now have a string of lights in the tree out front that marks the spot.

The wine list changes regularly which is nice. There's always something new I haven't seen before and the staff is ready to help you make a selection.

The food menu is all small plates and charcuterie. I highly recommend the brussel sprouts. They are simply seasoned and roasted and the best damn things on the planet. Remember when you used to hate brussel sprouts? Try these. They'll not just change your mind, they'll blow it.

The atmosphere is super chill. The furniture is nearly all made by one of the owners which gives it a nice warm feel. The lighting is soft and romantic. This is a great place to go after work with the girls or on the weekend with a date. Love this place!
author: Michelle H.

description: OMG a wine bar with awesome food.  Okay so their food menu is limiting, however I got to order bussel sprouts in bacon.  Bacon makes everything better.  Mmmm...Love the atmosphere, that it's low key, and that I've never had a hard time finding parking.  Oh and the wine is great too!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Great little bar with great wine and atmosphere.  Nice to have it close to where I live to be able to stop by for an impromptu drink after work.   The wood furniture adds a touch of warmth that places like this need to make it inviting, especially now in the cold winter.  They serve small bites for those that need a little snack, and you get nuts and olives with your wine.  The wine is great and the selection is very diverse and the owner is friendly, always willing to pour a taste and make suggestions on what to order.  Once  you come a few times, you'll be treated like a regular where they know what you like.  I don't even remember what I had, I just described what I was in the mood for and he poured.    

My only suggestion, the bar stools are great but the ones at the tables around the bar are hard on the posture and not that comfortable.
author: Inga W.

description: I realized tonight that this local neighborhood wine bar gem has been open for five plus years.  We're so lucky to have it and I encourage those from other parts of the city to come by and enjoy the relaxed vibe and feel, excellent wine and beer & food. If you are a Chinon wine drinker, stop in and try the one they have on the wine list right now. Excellent!
author: Toby S.

description: The wine and beer is pretty good but the service was bad. Just bad. We ordered a three piece meat and cheese plate but it never came. The place wasn't busy and the bar tender was more interested in talking with friends than serving anyone on the floor.
author: Donald C.

description:
Cozy neighborhood wine bar. Great place to meet a friend after work. Be aware, though, that on a Friday night, the noise level inside is extremely high. I was sitting directly across from my friend at one of the high communal tables, and we were both nearly yelling in order to carry on a conversation. We asked for our check at the point when we were both hoarse from trying to speak loud enough to be understood. 

High points were the very knowledgeable server -- she steered me towards a luscious pinot noir that I loved (and ordered a 2nd glass of), the delicious cheese plate (selection of 3), and the dark wood interior. 

I'd return, but not on a Friday or Saturday evening when the decibels are at jackhammer level. Some people lose their hearts in San Francisco....I lost my voice at Internos Wine Cafe.
author: Jeanie S.

description: Internos is is a little secret slice of heaven tucked on Geary St. and Parker. The atmosphere is wonderful, the selection of wine (and craft brews) is amazing, not to mention the FOOD! The meat lover flatbread with goat cheese is to die for. Compliments to the chef!
author: Karina B.

description:
I remember telling my ex-boyfriend at least a few times while we were together that we should try this place sometime.

The plan never came to fruition.

However, since then I have spent quite a few evenings here on dates with some of my closest friends (they're the best!). Adnan, the owner, has always offered a couple of different tastings in order for me to find the perfect glass of wine to cry into (he is also the best!).

Internos just has this really warm and comforting vibe. The wall art is always calming, and there's almost always a sports program showing up at the bar. The variety of different places to sit--the bar, the high communal table, several individual short and tall tables and stools, or the couch--makes it ideal for everything from a night out with the ladies to a first date to an intimate let's-bash-my-ex sesh. I'll admit guilt to 2/3 of the aforementioned...

Plus, everything on the wine menu has been handpicked from around the world. Order something to eat (everything's delicious) and you'll also get some yummy spicy olives and nuts (and chocolate covered raisins, what!) to munch on.

At the end of the day, I'd say it's a good thing I never brought him here. As such, the place is untainted and only conjures memories of getting over the asshole, not being with him. Thank you friends, and thank you Internos, for guiding me through that process, one wine-induced evening of defusion at a time.

And if you're reading this, and I really hope you do sometime... hi, Chris. Fuck you.
author: Kate V.

description: A nice gem for the Richmond District.  Wide selection of wines.  I love the artwork on the walls.  A relaxing, cozy, casual atmosphere.
author: Warren L.

description: Happy to have a neighborhood wine bar! The wines are good, and rotate frequently. The prices are a little steep, but they often have deals on Facebook.
author: Ani L.

description:
Interesting variety of wine blends from different regions, with a knowledgeable bartender to boot... went on a Thursday night and noshed on some cheeses (another good recommendation from the bartender). Not too shabby for the inner Richmond neighborhood!

A little on the pricey side, but still a cozy place to go for some nice wines.
author: Andy A.

description:
Caldecott Tunnel at 6 p.m. Bay Bridge at rush hour. Living 20 minutes away.  These easily aggravating factors are not enough to deter me from coming to Internos on a weekday night for delicious wine in a great, friendly atmosphere.  This has become the BFF's and my regular spot for wine, especially on Monday and Tuesdays when bottles are half off (you can't beat a bottle of wine at the start of a rough week).  

Adnan the wine master extraordinaire is excellent about making recommendations so if you are feeling overwhelmed or unsure of the varietals, just ask him.  Great little light snacks too so you can satiate your appetite while sipping your Malbec.  

Definitely worth my trek through traffic and across town to go to this neighborhood gem!
author: Rebecca H.

description: Such a cute little place.  Came for happy hour with a girlfriend and had a salad and cheese plate with our wine.  The wine list is really creative, and the atmosphere was perfect on a weekday right after work.  I'll definitely come back!
author: Cori D.

description:
Darn, lots of smoke in the reviews on here. Here's my experience, full of yuppies or not....

A friend and I stopped by as we'd heard it would be a *fantastic* place to host our friends engagement party; they just moved back from Argentina and they're both fond of fine wines and good food. So, we emailed the owners and let them know we'd be by. We got a very immediate, professional response.

We were pretty much treated like gold from the  minute we walked in. Adnan was busy with customers (of all types btw) however he made it his priority to keep us busy while he could get a chance to discuss our needs for the party should we book.

The wines are impressive. They rotate their list every two weeks so you can be sure there is always something new to try. The menu is incredible for a wine cafe; we ordered the hummus/avocado bruschetta, salami mozzerella pannini and caprese salad. Portions were HUGE compared to to other wine bar portions and everything was fresh; as if the breads just came from the oven an hour before.

Quinn was equally as friendly when she introduced herself; they both pretty much made it impossible for us to decline hosting a party there. And this goes w/o saying they didn't even sell us on the place - they just did what successful business people do: keep customers happy.

We are so excited to have them help us throw an incredible party in a few weeks. It's nice to give money to people that give a darned.

*** Kudos for the Yes on Dogs policy. Moose hangs out behind the bar and there were two other super mellow pups just chillin'.
author: Meredith R.

description: On the plus side: I was able to sit at the bar with my dog and order food.  Completely against health code but I dig it.  Wine list is lovely, food is decent.  The service is horrendous.  Not one person asked me how my wine or food was, and I had to sit around and listen to the employees talk about their dental health.  Gross.
author: Meg N.

description: I love this place!  It's super cozy and beautifully decorated.  I have been coming here regularly for over 2 years.  It's my local neighborhood wine joint and my personal favorite spot to go for a nice glass of wine.  Lots of locals frequent.  Great selection of wine and Liza knows what I like at this point so she always pour me a nice glass.  She's awesome!  I host a lot of gatherings here and they always take great care of us!
author: Coraly S.

description: Super cozy. Interesting crowd. Sometimes snob-alicious. I don't know, good wine, sweet appetizers. The wine tenders know their shit! On a quiet night I wouldn't mind coming here to unwind. Usually crowded on the weekends. Weeknights are best to come. The lighting is intimate, cool first date spot for all the beautiful winos out there.
author: Jen M.

description: Love this wine bar.  The staff is 'over the top' amazingly nice and helpful.  We go here as often as we can. The food is delicious and wine is top notch.  They are very knowledgable about their wines, I usually go in and ask them for a suggestion and I am never disappointed.
author: John K.

description: What a cute little place! Great wine, knowledgable and friendly service, tasty bites and the decor is on point. Love it :)
author: Lauren B.

description: Just met a girlfriend here tonight for a leisurely wine night and we really enjoyed ourselves.  It's great to have a wine bar with such an educated and diverse wine selection out in The Richmond/Laurel Heights.  We both had a fantastic red and white wine.  I would like to see a few more wines priced under $10 on the list but I get it, it's SF after all.  Love the free snacks they give you (olives, nuts, chocolate). I don't think they have a kitchen which makes food limited , but hey look what Local's Corner can do induction burners.  Bruschetta was decent maybe stick to good ole' meat and cheese on a plate next time!  Great atmosphere diverse crowd but it does get really loud once it fills up.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Stumbled across Inernos while we were waiting for the rest of our party to eat at Assab. I like the ambiance, very casual, but upscale. Everything is wood and it has a gritty feel but also feels really nice.

I sat down to two really friendly bartenders who chatted with me about the different wines. After a taste of their Malbec, i was hooked. It was such a smooth flavor with the end bite that I love. After that I ordered their pinot which was another great choice. They have almonds and pistachios served with the wine. They're not just your average almonds and pistachios, they are seasoned really well, with the almonds being kind of sweet, but not honey roasted. And the pistachios? Probably some of the best I've ever had. They had a spice seasoning that I want to figure out what it was because it was so good.

I ordered a cheese platter (was getting hungry). Their cheese is kind of standard, nothing to write home about. But its me and I always enjoy cheese.

With easy street parking and an amazing Ethiopian restaurant nearby, you better believe I'll be back.
author: Analisa S.

description: Fabulous little wine bar that's perfect for having a casual glass of wine, some bruschetta and great conversation!  How is it that you can walk down Geary and never really "see" these cool little places.  I was delighted to find this place within walking distance of my home!  Five Stars!
author: Ryan L.

description: A little pricey but delicious wine and solid food (though we just got appetizers). I know very little about wine but know enough to see that this is a good place to increase my knowledge.
author: Reed L.

description: Delicious wine and appetizers! Really enjoyed the flat bread piazza!  Friendly service. We will be back!
author: Martha N.

description: Interesting and reasonably priced wine selection.  Good balance of meat vs cheese on charcuterie platter.  Friendly bartender.
author: Neal S.

description: The winebar tender/sommelier, Liza (spelling not exact), was great and gave us awesome wine recommendations. We've been to a fair amount of wine bars in SF and it's nice to know that we can pop into a good neighborhood place and get good wine and excellent and friendly service.
author: Nick K.

description:
I started writing this review on December 3... 2009.  No WONDER they took my Elite status away from me!  In all fairness I WAS really preoccupied with the small business of raising my son while incubating his little brother and working full time.  I mean, I deserve a break don't I?  And don't I deserve to provide some sort of explanation before my Eliteness is just RIPPED from me?  And see??? I couldn't even protest this injustice in a timely manner, I was so busy!   

But I digress... 

I'm talking about Internos... the super sexy wine bar in the not-so-super-sexy Geary corridor.  I've been here several times and enjoyed many a glass of wine.  The owner is a lovely guy and not only has great taste in wine but art as well.  I always leave this place with at least one bottle of wine and wishing I could afford to buy a painting or two.  AND, this isn't your typical snooty patooty wine bar (is that how one spells "patooty"?).  I'm welcome here whether I come with work colleagues, my hip Saturday night crew or the mommies' book club.  Gotta love that...

 And oh, how I do!
author: LeSLiE W.

description: I've been here a few times now during what I would consider peak hours and I haven't seen the place super crowded, which is nice. Probably cuz it's a bit pricey, but well worth it. They have a great selection of wine and beer on tap, along with appetizers. I've always found the servers to be attentive without being pushy. Chill atmosphere; it's upscale and trendy, but not snobby. Perfect for small groups to relax over drinks.
author: Nathan E.

description:
This place is a rock solid neighborhood wine bar.

They were awesome, we had a coupon that expired and they still honored it, now that is customer service.

Also they were so busy our waiter didn't even work there! how funny.

Not a fan of their Lebanese wine....it was very interesting, too interesting (it had a stinky taste to it...)
author: Eric A.

description: One of my very favorite spots in the city... I am just lucky it's in my very own neighborhood. A great place for a glass of wine with friends - or with a book! Everyone there is very knowledgeable, and they have a terrific selection.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Great little whole in the wall! I would come here more often if I were living closer. Came here Saturday night to this bubbling crowded wine bar. Very generous pours. One of those places where locals come here so often, they sometimes help pour wine. Suffice to say, super friendly service.

I tried 2 whites and 2 red. Whites were good; South African red was good, Lebanese red was very odd tasting. I'd not order the Lebanese red wine again.
author: Carol L.

description:
On our latest visit to Internos, we came by with a friend to grab a glass of wine and chat.  I've been here four or five times now, and every time I've been pleased with 1) the number of people in the bar, and 2) the noise level.  The place always seem to be reasonably full, but the ambient noise and the music are never too loud that you can't hear yourself talk.  It really is an awesome alternative to heading out to a crazy, packed bar in the Marina.

We love this place and appreciate having an option like this in our neighborhood.
author: Tim N.

description: Super chill, laid back vibe. Dark, moody decor. Get there early when its quiet, gets loud as the night comes. Friendly staff, flatbreads are big and yummy. Nice for a laid back happy hour.
author: Christine Y.

description: Had a lovely time at Internos last night with my date. Quiet place on the weekdays with beautiful decor that is good for first dates or talking intimately or intellectually with friends.  Bar tender was sweet and had good rapport with the locals.  Didn't try the food but would like to next time.  Give it a try.
author: Taylor K.

description: Hidden gem right across the street from my apartment... EXCELLENT!!  For casual or a date, this will satisfy any wine-lover :)
author: Poonam L.

description:
I've been here a couple of times before/after movies at The Bridge and it's a nice little place to while away some time with a glass of vino.  

I've never tried any of the food here, but they always provide complimentary pistachios and olives, with your wine which is a nice touch!

I always sit at the bar, but there are lots of sofas around.  The decor is a nice warm brown color scheme with lots of candles.  This seems like it would be a nice place to go later in the evening if you were on a date or something, but I'm not sure how crowded it gets later in the evening since I'm always here on the early side.

They also have free Wi-Fi, which is always a plus.

I didn't even mention the wine, did I?  They have a nice selection of wines that changes every couple of weeks and are happy to pour you a taste of anything you want to try (or a taste of something that they recommend if you're ambivalent...like I am).
author: Kimberly B.

description: This wine bar is so cozy and inviting.  They give you small, complementary plates to nibble on, full of nuts and olives.  Their wine is tasty and reasonably priced.  It never gets too crowded, so it's perfect for a date or to catch up with a friend.  I'd definitely return here!
author: Jade F.

description:
I think this place is just great and so nice to have this type of offering in the neighborhood full of great Asian ethnic restaurants and Irish bars - but not a whole lot else by way of sophisticated night out type places. Internos is doing something different and doing it really well. It has great lighting, beautiful wood, a snazzy bar and a decent, if not totally knock it out the park, wine selection. I tried some new stuff that night and I always enjoy being surprised a little so that was fun. A great place to meet friends for a few glasses - the ambiance and big wood communal table are cool. The big leather couches, nice TV and Wifi would make an excellent choice for a place to hang for an evening if your living room is not cutting it. I thought the snack like bites menu was tasty too.  
Highly recommended and looking forward to going back!
author: Kirsten M.

description:
I went for my first and last visit with this establishment on the evening of 11/7/09 to celebrate the upcoming nuptials of some friends of mine. 

The entire wine bar was closed to the public for this event. After a little more than half an hour, I decided to head to the bar to order a drink, since I had not realized complimentary wine had already been provided by the hosts of this event. My friend's boyfriend ordered a drink at the same time I did without incident. 

When I got to the bar to order, I told the male bartender, "I'd like to order a Riesling." 

To which he did not reply, "Coming right up." 

Instead he asked, "Are you part of this group?" 

"Isn't everyone here 'part of this group'," I asked.

Bartender shrugged his shoulders and said, "I don't know." 

"Isn't this a private party," I asked, "aren't you closed to the public?" 

Again he shrugged his shoulders and told me he didn't know whether or not it was a private gathering. Never mind the fact that he had obviously been scheduled that evening specifically to serve at this event, and had been bringing out food for the last half an hour that I'd been there. 

So let's get this straight. You're asking me if I'm part of a group you are not aware of? Huh? What? Just too ignorant.

I finally told the ignoramus, "Everyone here is part of this group. This is a private party."

He didn't ask my friend's boyfriend this question, he just gave the man his drink. I'm fairly certain that no one else was asked this question either. My friend and her boyfriend found it to be an odd line of  questioning, and so did the one other friend I told. 

It's a rare occasion that I resort to calling someone a name, like ignoramus, but I felt a little bit small in that moment because of his ignorance. Why he would assume I didn't belong or was not part of this group is something only he knows. 

But Internos has him to thank for my never patronizing this place again. I would never return to an establishment where I do not feel treated with respect.
author: Tashya W.

description: Came on a Wednesday evening. Really impressed with the service and knowledgable server. She's friendly and genuine with her recommendations - not pushing for a higher price but listening to your likes/dislikes. Also tasty bites to accompany the selective and thoughtful wine list. All around a good evening out for a hardcore city dweller.
author: Dahlia O.

description:
Nifty but imperfect.

I'm not a drinker at all. The frequency by which I consume alcohol is roughly one glass per 2-3 months, and only on special occasions. That said, it was joining a group of friends to celebrate a birthday that brought me to Internos.

It's a quaint neighbourhood shop nicely appointed by rich, dark colours and weighty woods that evoke thoughts of chocolate and warmth; especially inviting this time of year, but the wall-mounted plasma showing off a football game felt strangely out of place.

A rainy Sunday evening along with a party reservation meant the place was never uncomfortably crowded, though the acoustics left something to be desired. With a total of only 5 people (including us) as we waited for the remainder of our group to arrive, the pals chatting it up with the bartender already had the place in such a roar that I could swear it was like listening to a raucous sports stadium through the business end of a hair dryer.

Thankfully, the gal working was cordial and helpful in both inviting us and newcomers to our group and helping choose a starter from the menu. Not a long menu, but as a non-drinker, having a wide selection was of little concern, though everyone else seemed more than satisfied. The food menu was also a bit short and even simple appetisers took a surprising amount of time to hit the table despite a low population to serve, but the bruschetta and meat & cheese plate were quite good. Prices seemed a little on the high side across the board, but as a place clearly intending to lean on the fancy side, it didn't seem out of line.

While the initial greeting was nice, the service and attention to our party fell off dramatically soon after. If anyone wanted a refill or to order food, they'd have to excuse themselves from the table and go to the bar. I was disappointed to hear that they wouldn't offer individual tabs because people were coming and going throughout the evening, making it difficult and even a little unfair to those stuck with the bill at the end of the night. I also found it odd that one of the employees spent considerable effort trying to convince our party's host who she was and why she was there. Even after being corrected a few times, his incredulity refused to concede that in fact she had a grasp on her identity and our party's purpose. I nearly dared him to question my name.

Bottom line: a cute little wine spot in Inner Richmond that isn't overly pretentious, but carries some of the service snobbery. It suffices at serving a short but quality menu, but is not for those hoping to carry on conversations, unless you're good at one of these things: sign language/charades, lip reading, txt message, or ancient long-distance throat yodelling.
author: Aaron H.

description:
EXACTLY WHY I HATE YELP.

I was there last night and saw the issue that all these people are writing about below. There were 2 people that were TOTALLY making out and started taking their clothes off, pants!!! Are you kidding me? it was innapropriate for ANYONE, gay or straight, to be acting that way out in the open. Get a room! ANYONE doing this would have been thrown out of this bar. Guess what? bar owners and patrons do not want to see this whatever the case may be. Maybe that flys in other bars, but if this guy doesnt want it in his, then dont go there!!!!

I never heard comments such as 'faggots'. I think that is being made up to make a point, just like all these people all of a sudden are writing slanderous comments when they werent there.

JUST TO NOTE, ALL THESE PEOPLE WRITING THESE THINGS BELOW WERE NOT THERE. there were only two people involved, so I think its really stupid they are having all their friends write in like this.

This is why I hate Yelp. You take 2 people that act like idiots, and they ruin someones business when the owners are only trying to defend it.

The owner should not worry though, this neighborhood loves Internos, and has great patrons who dont want to watch this sort of thing, and the only thing there is to HATE there is people that maliciously try to ruin peoples livelihoods anyway!

FURTHERMORE Dont bother sending me messages, I wont read them and certainly wont waste my time responding. Im not defending what really happened to those that were not even there and are going by hearsay.
author: renee m.

description:
A great neighborhood secret.  Usually I pass by this place, yet when a friend invited me, I was pleasantly surprised and truly enjoyed the entire package!  

The place is inviting with all the natural wood seating, high ceilings and cool artworks displayed by local artists.  The wine sections are plenty to choose from and the food tasty and not overly done.  Owners are friendly, personable and seem to enjoy every new customer that walks in.  And locals seem to always end up here on any given night.
author: Marie S.

description: Great neighborhood wine bar.  All the mom's and dad's in the area go here to hold committee meetings, girls night out, etc...
author: Frank M.

description:
I've been remiss by not writing a review for this place sooner. 
Its small, cozy, and the perfect little out of the way respite from the bustling streets. 
Came here with a friend of mine who fancies herself a wine aficionado and it got her seal of approval. Great wine list and laid back vibe. I enjoy feeling like I am in a secret hideaway spot that has yet to be marred by mainstream tourists looking for run of the mill libations.  
Try it out for yourself and find that this establishment is a nice place to go to have a civilized drink.
author: Stacy T.

description:
Love love love that you can order half glasses of any wine they serve by the glass. The pours are quite generous, so a half-glass is often the perfect amount for me. And if you haven't had your fill after that, it leaves the option open to try out others.

The two wines I tried (Pinot Noir that was described as "delicious" - how can you so no to that?! and the Malbec) were both pretty good. The Pinot was a little acidic for my taste, but pretty good overall. Malbec was spicy yet smooth. Definitely a bold one.

Didn't try any of the food, but it looked + smelled yummy.

I like my wine bars as cozy as the next person, but I was pretty much sweating in here. And I'm ALWAYS cold. Maybe it was just that particular night since it was quite chilly outside. I dunno.

Pretty empty considering it was a Saturday night. But it was great not having to eye people down to vulture their seats the moment they leave. 

Service was friendly. Verrrrrry laid back, which I dig. Plan to spend some time just sipping away. It doesn't seem like the place to rush.
author: Monica C.

description:
The owners of this joint are very nice and polite. I doubt they'd invite so much hatred and a boycott upon themselves. 
Let's reserve judgment and hateful reviews until the true story comes out.
Edited to add: The 'press' section of their website has a letter to the public about the incident.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Surly staff, mediocre wines, tons of dogs...

GROSS.

I just want to understand the local health code-- if a place serves food and wine, is someone on staff allowed to keep their huge, drooling pooch on the mat behind the bar? Just checkin...

Internos, as you probably know, is Latin for intern me now after having visited this place, and no, only plural, as in sooo many NOs.

This place might pass for a 'winebar' in suburban Indiana, but here in SF we actually have standards. Pity if you are Internos.

The only redeeming factor at this yawn-inducing spot is the woman who works the bar -- manager/ owner? Lord help you if she abandons you and your service is resumed by a scruffy man person. He is rude, hard of hearing, and unimaginative, and he will push horrible wines on you. 

...Speaking of horrible wines, the need-a-microscope to see the tiny selection, variety-lacking menu 'features' mostly CA wines with a French and South American or two thrown in for that sophisticated world view. 

The other redeeming factor of this tiresome winebar is the massive and festive share table at the front that can be reserved for I'm assuming doggie birthday parties as there were at least 3 in attendance the one and only time I visited.

I can think of thirty other wine bars off the top of my head that are better, and even buying a bottle or two and drinking them at your house would be a superior experience. No matter where you live. Even if you are in between homes.

I know there is not much to do at night in this corner of the city, and we all love our neighborhood joints, but in this case it's worth it to walk or take a bus or taxi to a wine bar that will serve good wine in a manner that is enjoyable. 

I just want YOU to have a super awesome night, kitten. You deserve it!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
While not a "wine" person, I found drinking at Internos quite a good time. 

Small, fairly quiet, low lighting and a general warm kinda theme, the place was really comfortable for a small group of us to sit, chat and drink about 3 bottles of the rosé (That's right, rosé. I don't care what you think). Not overly pretentious or fru-fru at all.

The place is pretty tiny but, that's part of the charm in my opinion. Also remember this is a wine bar so no hard booze here. They'll be no lemon drops for you, only some wines that you can try and nod in agreement when you sip it out of the glass in front of someone else. 

Really a top notch place to meet up for drinks (if you like wine!) during happy hour. With it's location on Geary, anyone in the area or on Geary can get to it fairly easy. A neat unique find for the area it's in
author: Andy A.

description: I've lived in the Richmond forever but only recently discovered this hidden gem.  Nice open area and great wine list and of course knowledgeable employees that made great recommendations.  I love their small plates and of course my favorite...meat and cheese!  I've already been back since my discovery 2 months ago and another plus....monday and tuesday nights are half off bottles..woohoo!
author: Allison T.

description:
A refreshing nugget of hipster-esque ('esque means no yuppie 'tudes, that I've seen...) cool tucked into a quiet stretch of Geary.  Wonderful, affordable, approachable wine list, with Adnan ready to pour anything in the world if you want to try first.

Unlike other wine bars, where you pay extra for olives and nuts, Internos sets you up with some of each as you sit down, a nice touch.  They also offer a small selection of thoughtfully-inspired sandwiches and small snacks that border on gourmet.

Usually bumpin' during happy hour, it is also nice to score a quiet 'off' night here, when you can really chat up your friends and Adnan, who clearly loves wine, and subsequently, his job.  It makes a world of difference to be taken care of by someone who enjoys what they are doing!

A spot I'll revisit. Plenty.
author: Lea N.

description:
This is a review for hosting an event at Internos Wine Cafe. I don't recall the last time I experienced such negligence and arrogance from one business. I usually never post bad reviews, but I had a horrifying experience at Internos.

Basically, I reserved a table to host an event at the bar for 30 guests and, like many events, the event did not get nearly the turnout that I expected (as an event planner, I know the drill). As a result, one of the owners, Quinn, pulled me aside for a scolding, including the accusation that I was "squatting in her business" and that "I should be lucky" Internos didn't charge me for the booking. Regardless of attendance, nothing I did justifies that level of rudeness and disrespect from a business owner.

Whole story: Last week, I called Internos to ask if it's possible to reserve a table to host a launch event to showcase my jewelry line. The employee I spoke with assured me that it was fine and booked me for a Friday evening. About a week after the reservation was confirmed and I'd begun planning the event, the employee calls back to say that she hadn't checked with her managers before making the reservation and they were "not comfortable" with hosting a vendor at their venue. That's understandable, but a) why was there no communication with the managers before confirming the reservation, and b) why did she call me back only a few days before the reservation to say they wanted me to cancel? To rectify the situation, the employee explained that the owners wanted me  to cancel the event or buyout the venue for the night if I wanted to host my party. I explained that I already had the event in the works, press had gone out about it, and I had 30 people on my guest list. Therefore, it wasn't fair to ask me to cancel or pay to solve the problem of the venue's internal miscommunication. As a result, they agreed that I could host the event (without having to do a buyout) with the agreement that I'd have 30 guests. Note that we did not agree on a bar minimum for my party.

A few days later on a Friday evening, the event arrived...but the turnout was terrible. Although I got press in a huge local publication (7x7 Magazine), I invited tons of guests and over 30 of them were confirmed, only 5 people showed up. Even worse, no one ordered any drinks or food (except me). Yikes.

Towards the end of the evening, Quinn approached my small group with menus. In an aggressive and annoyed tone, she asked if anyone wanted to buy drinks or food, while glaring at me. Understanding her frustration as the business owner, I strongly encouraged my guests to buy, as well. When none of them expressed interest, Quinn tossed the menus on the table and stormed away.

Not long after that incident, Quinn asked to speak with me in private when I had a moment. Once I explained some questions about my jewelry line to my guests, I walked over to where Quinn was standing by the bar. Then her nasty rant ensued.

As of result of low turnout and low orders from the bar (something I had very little control over), Quinn called me "disrespectful", "unprofessional", and a "squatter" in her business. Amongst other rude comments, I remember she said that I'm "lucky" she didn't charge me a couple hundred dollars to cover the expense. She also complained that she was "unhappy" and "very disappointed" because she asked my guests to buy food/drink, but they looked at her like she "had six heads" (maybe because everything at Internos is overpriced?). She concluded her tongue lashing by asking me to pack up and leave within 15 minutes. Seriously??

I understand her huge disappointment with low orders because the bar needs to make money. However, considering I had no prior agreement with the establishment for a bar minimum, her comments were completely inappropriate, rude, and offensive. I'm very surprised she called ME unprofessional...we probably wouldn't have had the conflict if Quinn had trained her employees properly in the first place, or at least taken more accountability for the lack thereof.

Never in my life have I felt so unwelcomed and belittled by a business. What a regretful experience at Internos courtesy of the poor management. If customer service is important to you, I would look elsewhere for hosting your next event.
author: Courtney P.

description:
Exactly why I hate people who hate Yelp.

I have been there with friends.  To say that folks can get thrown out of a bar and then say, it doesn't matter, "patron from the neighborhood will go anyway," doesn't speak much for the neighborhood.  Or for the moron posting this piece of crap.  I though the wine "cafe" was over rated primarily because it's the only venue for this type of thing in the area.  The wine was overpriced and there's not much of an opportunity to eat.  It's simply a bar that serves wine...big deal.

Oh, did I mention that they don't like gay people?
author: Criss R.

description:
Internos Wine Cafe is EXACTLY what the Richmond district needs! One of the owners, Adnan is awesome--personable, knowledgeable (in terms of wine and the world), enthusiastic and generous! Both times I've gone, he was more than welcoming, and remembered me and my cousin from our previous visit. 

I love their wine list! Plenty of pinot noirs and shirazs, and decently priced. The menu, the last time I went only had savory items, but we're promised that sweets were going to surface soon. The cheese plate is excellent, though I could do without the blue cheese (too potent for me!). The bruschettas are equally excellent with fresh ingredients and inventive and classic tastes and flavors. 

Dark woods, dim, but not overly so, makes for a classy and inviting atmosphere...you almost forget your in the Richmond district. 

I'm due back for a visit. We were promised sweets on the menu, television(s?)., and happy hour specials all throughout the week.
author: Marie B.

description:
I love wine bars/lounges, but this one is a bit too small, crowded, and loud for my liking. Barely any tables so crowds were milling and standing around trying to talk over the music and each other. Wine selection is not too bad and they had snacks and appetizers like cheese plates and sandwiches as well. Ended up leaving early since I could barely conversate with my friends. I guess I just prefer loungy places over bars. 

Maybe I'll give this place another try on a less busier night.
author: Vivian D.

description:
Cute wine bar with plenty of happy hour specials.
Adnan and Quinn are great hosts. Super down to earth.
What I love about this place is they always give you free tastings before you decide on a wine. 
Another bonus is the free marinated green and red mediterranean olives, a variety of nuts to snack on and if your lucky they even bust out free proscuitto pizzas for everyone to share!
This place is a definite must to check out!!! You will not be 
disappointed at all.
