They also have a nice array of different snacks you can order to munch on while your drinking that wine!
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
Last night.....two gay men were thrown out of this bar and called faggots!

Not very nice not to mention
author: maria g.

description:
Been here twice now for happy hour and ended up staying for a while. It's nice having a wine bar in the neighborhood and within walking distance of my Inner Richmond apartment. Both times I've arrived around 6 and found the couch in front of the window free. It's very a comfortable and enjoyable atmosphere. You're able to watch the whole bar and the street at once. 

The bartender is extremely friendly and very on point with his recommendations. My friends and I are very open to trying new wines and he is great in providing suggestions. He'll bring over a couple bottles, let you taste and then pour you your choice. The service is excellent and the atmosphere conducive to relaxing on a weeknight. And you can't beat half off their library wines on Mondays and Tuesdays.
author: Rebecca D.

description: This is a cozy place in a quiet residential area if that's your style. Pretty expensive though they do serve lovely free condiments.
author: Amy M.

description:
OK, after my first visit (a week ago) it was going to be four stars, but I've been back twice since then and it keeps getting better. SO HAPPY to have a Richmond wine bar. I love, love, love their diverse wine list -- there's a wine from every continent that makes wine, and the choices are informed and stimulating. Owner Adnan is personable and knowledgeable, always happy to recommend a new favorite. The wine list changes every few weeks. 

If you're not a wine lover, take note: There are 4-5 draft beers available, plus several more by the bottle. And for happy hour -- M-Sa till about 8 (call for exact times, I might be fuzzy on this) -- you get $2 off each glass of wine and $3 drafts. There's a big-screen TV for sports fans, but it's not a sports bar -- the volume is usually muted (and they'll change it if you ask).

If I had three thumbs, I'd give them three thumbs up. I've been three times in two weeks and expect to keep going!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
It took me two visits to this Internos Wine Cafe to inspire me to write a review. One was just to for a casual visit with friends and the other was for a art exhibit. Both times the experience was well worth the trip. They have a great selection of wines and at reasonable prices.

Inside is a bit industrial for my taste but after a few glasses it starts to get comfortable. The staff are fantastic and very personable. The appetizers are also really tasty and pare fantastic with the wine.  

While I have only been here twice I know there is a third sometime soon!
author: Ryan B.

description:
Unlike Luis C, the first-to-review-sniper, I've actually been to Internos.  That's what these reviews are supposed to be about, right?  "Real People, Real Reviews." not "Real Previews."

Anyway, Internos was a perfect place to kill an hour on a rainy Monday evening.  The interior is clean and well designed, if a little sparse.  The art on the walls gives me a headache, but other than that, the place looks great, with dark wood, candles, interesting light fixtures and a dark marble bar.

The bartender was jovial and kept bringing us little nibbles and unsolicited top-offs.  It's worth checking out the place now while they are eager to woo you. I really appreciated the way he almost insisted that I try everything I ordered before pouring me a full glass, including the house brew, which is a light, hoppy beer that they have brewed specially for the shop.  It's a nice touch.

They said that the TV is on it's way, which worries me, since I'm not a television in the bar kind of guy, but if they keep the sound off or play old movies, I wouldn't object. 

Internos is a fantastic new spot and despite the location, it's worth the trek.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I love Internos! Thank you for finally bringing a great wine bar to the neighborhood. 

We have been there a couple of times and every time the staff has been great. They always take the time to ask us what we are looking for and let us sample the wine before purchasing. Also, they allow you to bring your well-behaved pooch here late at night. 

Love it!
author: Alisa S.

description: Great spot conveniently located near me. Good wine & beer selection, friendly and helpful staff...what more do you need?
author: Dilly M.

description:
I visited Internos during the first couple of weeks during which it was open, so things may have changed since then, but the decor wasn't bad and the owners were incredibly nice. The chairs (stools) at the tables are pretty uncomfortable, but the stools at the bar are more comfortable. We appreciated the little snacks (nuts and olives), but we had 4 glasses of wine between the 2 of us and only one was even borderline remarkable -- the other 3 were only so-so. For $50 I was a little disappointed. 

Frankly, I also think that starting $10+ a glass at a wine bar (especially, let's face it, in The Richmond) is a little steep. The entry-level prices for a glass of vino at other SF wine bars (like California Wine Merchant in the Marina, Arlequin in Hayes Valley, and Ferry Plaza Wine Merchant) are much cheaper and I've always enjoyed what I've been served in each of these places.

The other reviews for Internos have convinced me that I need to revisit, and I hope to have tastier wines the second time around.
author: J C.

description:
The reasons why I love this place:

*It's in my hood, which means I don't have drive, catch a cab, or walk down a dark street

*A wine list turnover every two weeks.  This is great.  Means you'll likely never have the same wine twice....that is, unless you're THAT kind of wine-o

*Um, there was a lady with her Golden there tonight.  Suh-weet!  I'm down.  Felix and I will be heading here and taking up residence on the couch sometime in the near future.

*Nice nuts

*Fantastic owner/partner running the joint who was laid back, easy to talk to, and interested in everyone that was in there.

*Did I say it's within walking distance of my crib and I can bring my dog in there?
author: Tamar D.

description: What a neighborhood gem! Great selection of wine and beer as well, friendly service, cute atmosphere and a stone's throw from my house. I love it.
author: Tatyana K.

description:
Since I started dating my gf I've turned into the ultimate wine snob, actually make that elitist. So, when I found this place in my hood I was glad that I had somewhere to go and imbibe upon the grapes of wrath.

The decor is simple and clean, lots of wood and earth tones and low lighting. It really sets the mood for relaxing with some good wine.

The wine list is impressive and very worldly, guaranteed to appeal to almost everyone. The wine list also changes on a weekly basis and doesn't leave you feeling like you're going to the same stagnant watering hole. Their beers are top notch too, don't expect Bud or Stella in here. They also have a pretty decent cheese and charcuterie plate and other fare if your appetite is a little larger.

Best addition out in my area in a while and the owners are super friendly too, I'll continue to come back here.
author: Gary T.

description: Great wine lists with lots of different things to try. Also had the Brushetta with proscuitto, mozzarella, and basil which was yummy. Everything was a little pricey, but nice place to relax and have a drink after work.
author: Rosemary S.

description: I've been here 3 times now and have nothing but good things to say about this place. The owners are friendly and provide great recommendations. The beer selection is also amazing. I'm glad to have this place in my neighborhood...if only it could be like 5 blocks closer.
author: Janelle L.

description:
A friend and I decided that it had been a long time since we'd caught up and the two of us drinking wine would be a great way to unwind after a long day. She lives near Internos and recommended it. At first sight I didn't know what to think. The place was packed and the windows were all steamed up as if someone has just had a passionate, back of the Corolla sex kind of experience. That and there were hand prints and messages in the foggy windows.

As we waded through the crowds we found out it was a party, but the host, Adnan, saw us and still invited us to stay. We found a table near the front and we decided on a bottle of Sonoma County pinot noir from the Lyeth Winery. It was a delicious bottle.

I only have one gripe and that is the bottle was $48. Online, you can get it for $17.99. That's a little bit of a hefty markup. No, that *is* a hefty markup. I understand you got costs to cover but dang! Despite this, the energy here was nice and service was spot on and friendly.

4 stars for service, minus 1 star for prices which were a bit high.
author: Aaron F.

description:
This place rocks!!!! 

I love the wine selection here, the vibe is great and the crowd is fun. My husband likes the beer selection too and the food is great to snack on...I will definitely be coming back soon fore more. 

This neighborhood needed a place like this...cheers...
author: Lindsey W.

description:
I just happened into this place last night, and it turns out they've only been open for a week, but they seem to be doing well already.  I needed a place to meet two friends from Barcelona who were in town, and another friend of mine recommended Internos. It turned out to be a great recommendation (although it's very hard to find at night - they need a lighted sign!).

The owner, Adnan, took very good care of us, bringing us all kinds of delicious wines and very yummy small plates (cheeses, prosciutto, artisan bread, crostini, etc). Adnan is enthusiastic, funny, and a terrific host. And he made all the furniture himself - which he is very, very proud of.

It was a particularly perfect place to meet my friends from Barcelona, since it felt a little like some of the great little informal tapas places that are a big part of the Catalan lifestyle. 

Internos is a very comfortable place to enjoy good wine, good food, and good conversation. You'll enjoy it.
author: Bret W.

description:
How can you beat a neighborhood wine bar that has a chocolate lab puppy running the place?  Ask to see "Moose."  You won't be disappointed.  

While the puppy stole my heart, the owners were a close second.  Very friendly and welcoming, and made me feel comfortable even though I came at an odd time and was the only person in there.  I think Internos will give a much-needed community gathering place to the neighborhood.
author: Ellen H.

description:
Nice addition to the neighborhood. I have been here twice, would've been 3x, but they weren't open the first time my husband I stopped by. The service was friendly (we sat at the bar) and the wine selection is just fine. They did not have the pinot noir listed, but the bartendar offered up a replacement -- from Chile. I'm not usually a fan of Chilean wines, but I found it to be delicious.

They also have a nice selection of delectable light dishes to choose from; however, as a "pescadarian", it can be a bit limiting. Though I enjoyed the complimentary mixed nuts and tasty olives, which prompted my girlfriends and I to order another glass of the pinot!

4 stars out of 5 b/c they didn't have the American Pinot Noir and a bit on the noisy side
author: Christina Y.

description: You can watch sports here and drink wine with a free nut tray with almonds cashews and pitted olives. Its very chill and not in your face typical snob bar. Perfect.
author: First L.

description:
Came with my wife for a glass of wine and cheese. Nice ambiance and interior design. 

Since there were just a couple of dessert wines on the menu, I asked if they have ports. One of them was a Hungarian Tokaji for $12.  In response a waitress brought another "Library Wine" menu with a few more options. The first one... the same Hungarian Tokaji for $10. What happened next could take place in a cheap diner in a highway rest area, but not at a Wine Cafe which charges $15 for a glass of an average wine.

"I think you have some price discrepancy", I said.
"Yeah, you are right, it's a typo. I can give it to you for $12, not $10."
"What if the typo is on the one which says $12?", I joked.
"No, I am pretty sure it's $12 so would you like to order that?" Then after a long pause, "You know, maybe you should get something else."

We looked with my wife at each other in disbelief and another long pause ensued.

"Ok, fine, I'll give it to you for $10 if you really want to", said the waitress with barely hidden attitude.

We asked for a couple of cheeses and a glass of wine each but the mood was spoiled and I am still not sure why we just didn't get up and leave. $2 is not something what would break anybody's bank these days. But when such a pretentious, slightly over-piced place is trying to nickle and dime you, it's unacceptable. Or maybe it was just a waitress in a wrong line of work.

Either way, we won't be coming back.

Michael
author: Michael S.

description:
I walk in for the first time, and they literally know me by name. Talk about a reception!  This is how well they always treat you.

Every time I come in here, I taste several things on the menu before selecting my glass of wine.  Not only do they give me plenty of time to do so, they enthuse with wine knowledge and relaxed graciousness.

Nice group of people hang out here in this Western SF find.

My only suggestion is to increase the small plate offerings.  There is not really enough to make even a  small meal. But the olives and bread bites that are there are delish.
author: maia j.

description:
Great place. Internos is a great addition to the neighborhood. The service is excellent. The owner is very friendly and helps you pick out a good wine. He will give complementary tastings of differnet wines and is very knowledgeable. The small plates of food are delicious and made on the spot. It has a Spanish tapas feel to it. 

Group place for a glass of wine with a couple friends or a date. It's not too loud so you can have a nice conversation. 

I will definitely return to Internos and am so glad to have a new bar in the neighborhood.
author: Naomi H.

description:
Seeing as the 38L is my best friend, I pass this place everyday! I have been wanting to try it out for months, but not until last weekend was I ever so lucky.  My aunt (wino) was in town and knew we would love this place.  Yes I heard about the bad press, but I am not one to judge without getting the whole story and certainly trying it out for myself.  I am glad I don't listen to Yelp reviews from people who have never even been an establishment.  

The owners weren't there but Karima was in charge for the weekend.  Boy did she sure take care of us.  To be honest, I can't remember what wine I had, but it was delicious.  They had a great selection to choose from and I knew no matter what I chose I wouldn't be disappointed.  Aside from exceptional service and wine, we also made a new friend Karima.  She was extremely personable, kind, and had a fabulous quality about her.  Karima sure did the owners proud! I will definitely be back, especially since it is in my hood.
author: Samantha R.

description:
When my friend said she wanted to grab a quick bite before catching a movie at the Bridge, I groaned 'cos I knew that there is nothing in that neighborhood that meets our nit-picky requirements of great atmosphere, good food and yummy wine or cocktails.  Well I was wrong!

We had a delicious bottle of Sauvignon Blanc with complimentary nuts and olives (good ones at that - not just icky peanuts and canned olives), accompanied by a platter of cheese and charcuterie... which was several very good cheeses, salami, prosciutto, apricots and cornichons - generous portions, too.  Our server was lovely.  

Great photographs on the walls... nice lighting/ambiance and music.  I have to say the only downfall was the rather uncomfortable stools.

Otherwise, loved every moment and going back again this week!
author: Lorraine F.

description:
So excited and happy to see a wine bar in the neighborhood!  Now we have options besides heading to the Irish bars or RoHan's.

Went there this past weekend with my husband to have pre-dinner drinks.  Love the ambiance and decor, although it was a very crowded night with two large boisterous crowds in there and it was so hard to hear my husband talk when he was just sitting next to me at the bar.  It seems like they need to install some sound abosrbing panels because with a large crowd in there...it was deafening.

Wine list was okay. I was thinking since it was a wine bar, they would have more exciting wines on their list to try, such as more from South America or other regions besides California.  They only had two types of sparkling wines on their "by the glass" list and only two additional by bottles.  I also would expect a wine bar to have tasting flights, but instead they only had two prices on their wine menu which was "Glass or Bottle" price.  Also our wine person at the counter, was paying more attention to his group of friends who came in then to us or other people at the wine bar.  Not a good impression.

Price was a bit high for a glass of Cuvaison Pinot Noir we were charged $18.00.  I know a bottle is approximately $30.00 retail at BevMo, so I understand they need to make their profit, but perhaps if it was a different type of Pinot Noir from a wine maker you cannot find at Bev Mo I would have gladly paid $18.00.

The wine person (not the owner) did mention that they were going to be revamping their wine offerings as well as extending their menu more.  So for now, I give them 3 stars, but I will return in 2-3 more months and see if they tightend up their wine list, menu and service.

Good for what it is....but I know they could be better.
author: Pam P.

description:
Quaint little neighbourhood place. An eclectic wine selection, and a limited but good (Stella, Hoegaarden, Guinness and own brand) beer selection. They also have small tapas style dishes which looked good but I didn't get the chance to try any. The service was good and the decor tasteful if not particularly interesting. They have a very cute chocolate lab puppy too!

It was reasonably busy for a Tuesday night, but more than half the crowd were friends of the bar staff, and there was only one other group. I'm guessing it's probably pretty empty on a typical weekday.

I would definitely come here if I lived nearby and wanted to catch up with friends over a quiet drink. Alternatively, this would be a good weeknight post dinner spot if eating in Laurel Heights. Although, I don't see any reason to make a trip from another part of town just to go this bar.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
Love it that a nice new wine bar is actually in my 'hood- Laurel Heights-ish/ Inner Richmond-ish.  

The owner was behind the bar, and super friendly, accomodating, and nice.  He let us try a couple of wines before I chose a Sauvignon Blanc.  We received some free "bar bites" which were a variety of nuts and olives, and also really lovely chocolates.  Mmmmm, wine and chocolate.  Basically we parked it here all night, and had a great time.  It's not so loud, so you can actually have a conversation.  People in the bar were really friendly.  The chap next to us bought us ladies prosecco, and the owner made sure it was a-flowing.  

The atmosphere is really comfortable, yet chic.  A great place to have a small birthday party, or to go with a date.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Great ambience, open space and very good service. Go early on a weekend, and then grab dinner at the japanese place next door, or Assab Eritrean a few blocks away.

Get the cheese plate and warm bread, with a nice red. Will try their Bruschetta the next time am there!
author: Sumit C.

description: I live in Laurel Heights, so I was really excited to try this place on a date night with my boyfriend because it's nice and close and there certainly aren't many restaurants of this type on oh-so-charming Geary. We walked in and sat down, got a couple menus, and ordered a glass of wine each. We summoned the waiter back to order food, placed an order for a (1) meat & (1) cheese plate, plus the prosciutto flatbread. We showed up at 5:45 knowing we had to leave by 7 at the latest to make a 7:20 movie. When none of our food had arrived by 6:40pm (nor had we been checked in on) we told the waiter about our movie tickets and time, and how we were in a bit of a time crunch. I watched him go back to the order screen, print out an order ticket, and bring it back to the kitchen, so it was obvious he had never turned the order in in the first place. He came out and said our food would be right out, no apology, no acknowledgement of the mistake. They brought our food out with 10 minutes to spare, so we scarfed it and took off. For a $75 bill, I would have expected way better, and more attentive, service on a night where the place wasn't even half full.
author: Katie H.

description: The wine selection was decent, the waitress was very nice. Overall the place had more of a sportsbar feel to it: bros drinking beer, playing dice, watching football, and satelite radio playing Sublime. I will try another wine bar next time.
author: Miss Giallo M.

description: My wife & I love internos.Adnan& Quinn did a great thing opening the wine bar here.So nice & the great wines are always changing with new great finds from all over the world.also a nice collection of top quality beers.Non of those awful mass produced beers.They also have a small menus of nice small plates.This place is a jem & if you go be sure to say hello to the owner if he is there.his name is Moose & he is very friendly too.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I just went here for the first time tonight after work, and the owner was nice enough, that I've decided to write my first yelp review in almost a year.  I came around 5 after work, just a few days after they opened. I really like the look of the space inside, and the wine I had was excellent.  I only tried the marinated olives on this trip, but they were marinated there at the bar, and were very good too.  

Above all the owner, whose name I asked twice, yet still can't remember right now, is very nice and made the experience enjoyable.

Glad this place just opened so close to my house.
author: Matthew S.

description:
An excellent experience! 

I went there on a date last night and it could not have been better. Adnan comes out from behind the bar to greet you and bring out the menus; no attitude, no airs, he just really wants you to enjoy yourself. He did not just recommend a glass, but instead brought me three tastings to make sure I got what I wanted. Over the course of the night, I was able to sample nine different varietals, including some that were not on the menu, and was thoroughly happy with my selections.

The ambiance was very casual, with a nice HiDef TV if you'd like to watch sports and a leather couch if you prefer to lounge.  A great place if you want wine without the snobberisms.

post script:  It was very warm in there at first, but Adnan was kind enough to prop the door open to allow a breeze.
author: Jesse C.

description:
Adnan is one of the nicest business owners I've met in the city.  He is extra attentive and allows patrons to quickly taste wines they are unsure of.  Unique wine list and generous pours.  

This is a neighborhood gem and everyone in the Laurel heights Lone Mountain area should come here.  It's a much needed and welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Erik K.

description:
After yelping this place (a cozy wine bar on Geary?! I'm in!) a friend whom I haven't seen in ages and I met for drinks to catch up and this was the perfect place to do it! The interior is absolutely stunning, with almost all of the beautiful wood furniture crafted by the owner/bartender Adnan, which for me, makes it all the more exquisite.

This place is friendly and unpretentious; Adnan took amazing care of us and the other patrons- my glass was never empty, he let us sample a few glasses and he made the rounds to chat it up with everyone. We also met some friendly dudes and had great conversation with my local neighbors :) We also ordered a meat and cheese plate that was delicious with all the booze we downed (somehow our bill was like $97 wooops!)

LOVED this place and will definitely be back- if you live in the area it is a MUST try!
author: Julia R.

description: Wine is great. Appetizers are great. The bartender was friendly, had great taste in music and was a joy to chat with. Simply put, its a wine bar, that serves food. Holds maybe 30 max. If you want a small, cute, good wine bar with some small plates, go here.
author: Z P.

description:
Great new wine bar on Geary st. (we kind of stumbled upon it on a drive home from Ideale in North Beach one day) with a pretty good selection of wines, a great atmosphere, and really nice owners (Adnan and Quinn) who are very knowledgeable and inviting.

Nice to have a place like this on Geary to stop by with friends or after dinner when you want another taste of wine or beer, or a little after-dinner munch.
author: Peter L.

description: Good atmosphere, great wine advice, strange location but well worth a visit!
author: Buddy H.

description:
Great location and ambiance!  Still has some work to do, including adding more wines and some more items on the food list.  But since it's only been around for 3 weeks, I think it's a great spot. 

 Finally a wine bar that's not stuffy and pretentious.  Defiantly looking forward to what they'll have to offer a few months down the road.  

As for what they do have, we tried a few wines that were nice including a cab.  Their Internos beer on tap reminded me of a sierra Nevada pale ale. 
As for the appetizers, we tried the hummus and pita bread.  As well as the Bruschetta which was excellent.  We tried 4 different kinds, my favorite had prosciutto and roasted garlic. 

Adnan was behind the bar and was very attentive and welcoming.
author: Chase F.

description: One of my favorite things about my neighborhood is that Internos is in it.  Friendly comfortable wine bar that I've found myself becoming a regular at.  Liza & Catherine always have great wine suggestions, the food menu is small and basic but always good.  Great place to hang out with friends, go on a date or just decompress with a nice glass of pinot after a long day.
author: Jeff C.

description:
good :
friendly staff
flattering lighting
not super loud
easy street parking

bad :
the wine selection
uncomfortable seating
one more time : wine bar with medicore wines
author: Missy D.

description: I just got home from Internos. I really wanted to love this place as it's in my 'hood. But instead a friend and I had a frustrating time there. We spent 112 bucks on two very small salads and three glasses of wine. The worst part of it was the terrible service. We fought to get a glass or wine. We waited 15 minutes before being acknowledged at the bar (and it wasn't busy). The male owner was snobby, it was obvious he had many of his own friends with him and couldn't make time to take our order. When I tried to ask the waitress questions about the wine list she was really rude. At 14 dollars a glass I expected her to be knowledgeable about the wine being served and friendly. Very disappointing experience. I would NEVER go back!
author: Meredith S.

description: A cute wine bar in the Inner Richmond? Really? I never would've guessed. Would I choose to trek all the way out to this area to go to a wine bar? Probably not. But it's a great option over all of the super dives if I'm in the area. When we went, it was a cold, windy Tuesday, so I'm assuming that's why this place was packed. But maybe it's always packed because like I said it's one of a kind in this neighborhood. I liked the large, somewhat dark canvas paintings on the wall...especially the odd, creepy looking dancing bear by our seats. We pondered over what that could possibly be, so it added some extra conversation to the mix. Their wines were also really tasty, and I liked their names and descriptions. I usually switch it up and taste new wines each time, but at this place I stuck to the same one. Little did we know, the bottles were half off....maybe that's why it was so packed? Would've saved us some money if we had either known what was up, or carefully read the menu, haha. Our bartender was super friendly and prompt, and the crowd seemed laid back and welcoming. Their food also looked really good, so next time I won't eat before coming here.
author: Sonya D.

description: We were in for the soft or grand opening, not sure which.  We had some of the tasty treats, a glass of Malbec, and a glass of Pinot Noir.  The wine was super tasty.  I thought the interior was nice, if not exactly cozy.  The staff was friendly, to say the least. YAY! I must say though...if you weren't looking for them, you would NOT see them.  They are right next to the dog place, if that helps.
author: H A.

description: Uh. So yeah. Nice atmosphere. INCREDIBLY PRICEY!  My credit card wept in fear when I got the bill for 4 glasses of wine and a couple of small plates of food.  Now I just go to Bryan's to pick up some delicious food and Wine Impressions and make my own atmosphere while getting twice as much food and wine for half the price.
author: EE C.

description:
Perfect place to have a party! I recently held a bday party for my boyfriend here and it was such a hit! Adnan and Quinn were very helpful in the planning - including how much food to order, what works well, etc. and they let me bring in my own bday pies -no cutting fee either. :) 
All of my friends liked how easy it was to find and how easy to find parking - bonus for friends from the North and South Bay as anywhere downtown is a nightmare but this bar is so close to 19th ave - it's very accessible. The wine and beer selections were a hit too! A definite place to look at for when you're planning your next get together, party, etc.
author: n s.

description: I got to try this place last night for the first time, despite the fact that I live a couple blocks away.  I will definitely have to make this a favorite!  My boyfriend and I ordered a few drinks and hung out there for a couple hours, and it was great.  The ambiance is nice, and the place is comfortable.  The girl working there was nice and attentive, and helped me choose some great white wines (big plus! this place isn't totally focused on reds!).  I also like that they apparently rotate their wine selection regularly, so I'll definitely be back.  Nice place for a date or a girls night :)
author: Erin B.

description:
Visited with a neighborhood friend, a regular visitor. Definitely a place worthy of a return visit. Super laid back atmosphere, well-designed and Adnan, behind the bar, is more than welcoming.

Looking forward to returning.
author: Mike G.

description:
Time to set the record straight regarding Friday evening. I am a regular patron of Internos and was in the bar myself and witnessed what happened, not to mention, I too am gay and don't recall EVER hearing the word faggot at Internos. 

Two men walked into the bar, did not order a drink, they sat by the window and then proceeded to think it was their own bedroom. A makeout session promptly ensued and one gentleman started to reach down the other's pants. That's when the owner POLITELY asked the men to leave. If you weren't there, don't dramatize the situation or make statements that aren't true. It is shameless for you people to go on an write yelp reviews when none of you have even set foot in this wine bar. 

If you had actually gone up to the bar and ordered a drink and not tried to get down your friends pants, you would have realized this is a more than welcoming establishment who has hosted many Tuesday evenings for the gay crowd.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
This is a great little neighbor spot -
Actually, I'm not a  wine buff and truth be told, not much of a drinker, but I love meeting friends here/they are big wine fans and it's suitable to all tastes (no pun there =D) ....the food bar menu is great/the place is low key and a good mix of a bit of attitude too!
author: E S.

description: One of the most laid back wine bars I have been to. So many wine bars can come across as pretentious or intimidating, but this one had a very comfortable vibe to it. Only criticism is that I wish they had a little more seating, but the place is very small. I came here for a private birthday party and all the seats were filled rather quickly. I love animals but I don't really dig people bringing them into nice establishments. But if you're down for that they are too. But other than that they have decent wine prices/specials and I enjoyed the light fare they offered. The fresh mozzarella, cherry tomatoes and basil bruschetta was particularly delicious. I wouldn't mind coming back sometime with a much smaller crowd so I get snag the sweet spot on the couch near the window.
author: Katie S.

description:
WRONG!!! I am a gay man, and have been to this place 4-5 times over the last month and the owner is SUPER friendly to me.  I might even say we're friends now. He remembered my name after one visit. He chats with me and really wants me to enjoy my experience and he recommends wines. I am not a regular at any bar, but always think of heading over here for the wine, even though I live in the Castro. I am more comfortable here and have made more conversations with people at the bar, than any other place I can think of. I just don't agree. The entire crowd was friendly and chatty, so I just have a real problem with anyone saying anything about this place being homophobic in any way.
The wines here are superb, the owner knows his stuff, and the friend I brought with me a couple times, keeps asking me why it is so inexpensive? The menu is simple but all the dishes are made fresh and compliment the wines nicely.
author: Brian B.

description: This place has potential but did not live up to the hype of reviews. Wine by the glass prices were quite high, avg. $12, especially considering the offbeat outer Geary location. The gf's wine was corked, bummer. Wine selection big but limited. Interior is nice and hand crafted but not super comfortable. Note to owners - go easy on the clorox cleanser you're using on the floors. Walking into a wine bar and first smelling bleach/chlorine really does major damage to the experience.
author: casey c.

description: My friends and I have been coming to Internos pretty much since it opened.  We found it by chance (perfect central location between our cross City houses) and have continued going here.  The wine, food, staff are all great!!  I'm not great at picking out good wine, but Adnan has yet to fail me on the perfect glass.  It's amazing for a little place on Geary what a social scene it can turn into on weekend nights.  That being said, I much prefer the mellow nights, sitting at the bar, talking to regulars, friends, and those who happen to wander in the front door.
author: Alexia M.

description: Internos is a great neighborhood wine bar.  The owners and staff have been very friendly to us.  The wine selection is great and the food is really good too.
author: Veronica M.

description: This is an awesome neighborhood wine bar (with some excellent beer and food too). The owner is very kind, friendly, and helpful. I go here regularly and would recommend it to anyone.
author: Scott T.

description:
This is hilarious...this place couldn't hold more then 50 people, and by the comments posted it's obvious (some flat out admitting it) that 98% of the people weren't even there. This is a situation to be dealt with by any witnessing patrons, the parties involved, and management. To come to Yelp of all places, post 1 star, and then convey your thoughts as though you were there and have all of the facts is truly reckless. Treating Yelp, or in a greater sense the Internet in general as your personal microphone and doing so by posting fact-less 3rd, 4th, and 5th hand accounts is awful. Or on the flip side the people posting this negative stuff are hearing only what the guys who got kicked have to say. 

Either way the agenda posting is to convenient and obvious.
author: Tony H.

description: Bad for business, this bar is homophobic they kicked out some friends of mine calling them faggots.  They were just there hugging and being lovey.  Truely UNCALLED FOR.  I will NEVER do business here ever AGAIN
author: Mother L.

description: A modern and trendy gem in the  old fashioned Richmond. You would not expect to see this place nestled in between the large number of asian establishments. I really enjoyed the dark, woody atmosphere and the service was excellent. The vibe is also unpretentious and wine selection is good. It is pricey but that is expected in any wine bar. I am excited to take my fellow winos here soon!
author: M K.

description: The perfect ambiance.  After having a drink with friends.  Well more than a drink... more like almost a bottle of the 11 year old Tawny Port.  I commented immediately "This is what Heart is trying to be."  It has class, nice olives & almonds, and people are friendly.  It's not some hipster wine bar.   The wine list is well done and the food is outstanding.  I will certainly be back.  This is not my hood per se and is a little out of the way for me.
author: Sabrina A.

description:
I was walking around the neighborhood the other night and saw this great new wine bar......at least new for me.  It was a slow Tuesday night and had a chance to talk to the owner and a friend of his for quite some time.  They were both very helpful and friendly and both had a great understanding of wine.  

I went back the following Thursday night and it was packed....... 

I had a great small plate that was very reasonable but way to much for me to eat.  They packed it to go and was on my way.  I will return and meet some of my neighbors.... if the tourists don't beat me there first.
author: Rick R.

description:
This is a great wine bar with two generous, kind hearted owners.

I find it somewhat ironic that there has been a mobilization of efforts to terrorize and discriminate against this establishment based on heresay.  If you weren't there, you really have no business passing such judgment.
author: Razor S.

description: Decent selection - although all the top 3 glasses I would've wanted were out, a little pricey, didn't try the food but the platters looked decent. Crowded on wed night. Closest wine bar (that I know of) to the sunset district.
author: Eric P.

description: To call this place a "cafe" is a huge stretch.  It is actually just another of the zillions of wine bars with snacks around SF.  And as a wine bar, the selection is not outstanding and the wines are overpriced.  If you are looking for a place with actual food to go with the wine...look elsewhere.  And if it's just a wine bar that you want, there are plenty with better selections and more reasonable prices.  As far as I can tell, the only thing going for this place is lack of competition in the immediate area.
author: Dan H.

description: I am reluctant to give this place such a high review because I want to be able to go there and find a table, but I have to say that Internos is great!  I love the food, I love the 1/2 price bottles of wine on Monday and Tuesday night, and I really like the people who own it.  I've only been here twice but will definitely come back!
author: Gami G.

description: First timer. Great little wine bar. Nice atmosphere and great wine menu. Will be back.
author: Clare C.

description: Nice wine. Nice Atmosphere.  Excellent service.  And absolutely amazing olives from Palestine! Will definitely go back.
author: Betty K.

description:
This was the most pretentious and overpriced place I have ever been to!
I have been in the wine industry for 20 years plus and was completely appalled by this attempt at a cozy wine bar. The staff was arrogant and uneducated on their product. As a customer, I was excited to see the introduction of  a long awaited wine bar to the neighborhood only to be completely disappointed. I was looking forward to a relaxing time, I left feeling ripped off and extremely disappointed. Be advised, if  you want to stay and hang out be prepared to pay $13 for a glass of cheap Chardonnay??!?!
author: Rosie C.

description: I just love this place!  Adnan and Quinn, the owners, are the most friendly welcoming people you could ever meet.  My friend and I live in the hood and whenever we go there they treat us like family!  I love that they let you "taste" the wine before you commit to a glass/bottle and they are very generous with their pours.  Nice chill wine bar!  I definitely recommend!
author: Susan P.

description:
Cute new place in a neighborhood badly in need of more places like this. Good ambience, great service, delicious wine, thought one star off for crazy prices. The sparkling wine I tried was amazing and they served us free chocolates, olives, and the likes with it. 

I hope to come back to try the plates next time.
author: Amy L.

description: So glad to have a new wine bar not too far from my house! This new spot is definitely a winner. The owner is super nice and friendly. He offered my friends and me free tastings of any of the wines on the first page of their menu. He also brought us olives on the house. We ordered a small cheese plate and a caprese style bruschetta dish. Food was good; albeit, not cheap. The wine however, was good and they had a nice variety between Italian, French and Argentinian blends. Can't wait to return and try more wine :)
author: Jenica M.

description: Great wine selection.   Good small plates/appetizers at non rip-off prices.  The atmosphere is v. chilled - all the bar staff make you feel welcome here.  This place is a jewel in the otherwise dull Laural Heights.
author: David H.

description: I love this place. In the middle of the city(ish). Great owner Adnand, great other bartenders Quin/Kareema, good wine selection, nice ambiance, good self brewed beer, and most importantly good Moose... I love that dog!
author: Amit M.

description: Recently met about 15 girls here for my Birthday/Networking Event, and it is a lovely place.  Very sophisticated, great food, beautiful wine, nice staff and the space is well laid out.  This is really a little gem near the Richmond. It's across from the Post Office on Geary Blvd., which is frankly a location you wouldn't necessarily expect to find a cute wine bar, but there it is...don't let the exterior or the location fool you, it's  comfortable but not pretentious.  The only reason for 4 rather than 5 stars is that I think they need a few bottles in the $25-30 price range, and as it stands right now, there is nothing under $30 or $32.  Other than that slight critique, LOVE IT!
author: Kate M.

description: I had a wonderful Halloween Birthday party at Internos!  We were treated so well.  The service was so accommodating...they really just wanted us to have a good time.  And we did!
author: Teri N.

description: Fabulous! Great wine, great food, great service, great ambiance. Really enjoy this place and am always treated well-
author: ryan H.

description:
The first time I walked in, adnan greeted my date and me immediately and asked what we were looking for.  We were not familiar with any items on their menu, so he brought out a flight before we bought anything.

We both ended up with a couple phenomenal selections.  Ambiance was a 5, wine was a 6, and the service was top notch.

Best wine bar in SF!
author: mike b.

description:
What a great wine bar!  My fiance and I wondered into Internos one Friday night and now return almost every Friday.  If you are looking for a brilliant wine selection, chill atmosphere and SUPER awesome staff,  you found the right place.  

One thing of note - the ceilings are high so the acoustics make it loud in there.  It's still worth it.
author: Shanna Q.

description: My husband and I love this wine bar, and its owner, Adnan. He's very friendly and cool, the ambiance and decor are really lovely, and the wines and Belgian beers we've tried have all been great. We try to stop by about once a week, often when it's late and quiet and there are only people from the neighborhood left. We hope to get there early enough to try the small plates soon, though.
author: Suzanne B.

description: A true San Francisco gem. They havent been around very long but people seem to like this little wine bar in the Richmond. We meet a few locals that hang out here often. The owners are very friendly and helpful. Making suggestions that satisfied us all. The decor was my farvorite part- large wood tables for groups and small, tall tables for couples as well as a bar. The walls are decorated with paintings and art work from 2 different artists- Beautiful stuff. I look forward to my next visit here.
author: Melinda Q.

description:
Internos is the best!! I could go on forever about why I love it, but I'll try to be concise:

Adnan and Quinn (owners) are awesome and treat you like royalty.

All of the food is surprisingly (for its modest prices and menu descriptions) delicious, due to the fact that Adnan buys only the highest quality ingredients. For example, the mortadella and prosciutto both melt in your mouth like I never knew lunch meats could.

The wine is fabulous. Adnan has the best recommendations and you can always taste before deciding on a glass or bottle.

It's just a few steps away from the 38 bus stop.

The vibe is cozy, casual, and friendly. Not at all like a pick-up joint.

There are often fun events, like chocolate and wine pairing/tasting, that are a great value.

The walls are adorned with a rotating selection of works by local artists.

This place has it all!
author: jalisa s.

description: great atmosphere and the owner was very cool and helpful. the food was very good also.
author: m c.

description:
Stopped in tonight for a drink before heading to dinner.  It still smells brand spanking new in here!  Matthew S. must've been one of the two other customers at the bar when I came in; the place was really dead.  I hope it doesn't stay that way.  Fair, it was Monday, and folks are broke and it was raining, but what a great, easily accessible spot to grab a great glass of wine.  I really like the space, and was much happier once they closed the door and I could get a little cozy.  The gentleman behind the bar was very nice; he let us try our wine selections before committing to a full glass and served us olives and almonds, though I'd guess there may typically be a charge for them.  Wines by the glass are on the more expensive end ($10 - $17), but we liked both wines that we had (a cab and a cote du rhone).  The appetizer list was hefty - featuring snacks, cheese plates, charcuterie, salads and bruschetta.  Everything you could want to snack on with wine basically.  Well, except chocolate maybe.
Secretly nestled into a nondescript spot on a nondescript block, you might miss it if you weren't looking for it.  I highly recommend you look for it.  It looks like it might be a great place for a private party as well if they're open to that sort of thing.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Great place for the ladies to come and enjoy wine, food and conversation in a safe atmosphere.  The food accompanies the wine perfectly and the wines offered are de-e-licious!
Nice place to come for a "cozy" date to enjoy the "club feel."
Friendly bar staff that are helpful on every level.
Thank you for providing a great place to relax.
author: Suzanne N.

description: This place is perfect.  OK, so if a gang of people join the fun...you won't hear your friends unless they use all their lung powers.  Other than that,  I can't think of a better excuse for a wine bar.  No snobbery, no fluff...just hip and delicious.  The food, complimentary nuts and olives are lovely, too.  Happy hour (4-8p on non-party nights)  is 240 minutes of good times and wines at 25% off.  Love it.
author: Amelyn C.

description:
I just had my 40th birthday party here and I've never done a Yelp review before but felt like I wanted to thank Adnan (hope you see this) and his staff for a FABULOUS experience.  There were 20 or so of us at the big table in the center (perfect setting for a party---they reserved that spot for us)---and yes, I did notice a few doggies there that night---fine by me, I love dogs and dog friendly bars (Stephanie B., I don't know what your problem is----if you dislike dogs, perhaps you need to get out of San Francisco).

That said, delicious wines, great small plates, many of which involved pork product (my favorite meat), AND, we were even given a free bottle of wine at one point---very nice!!  They also have a decent beer selection.  They allowed us to decorate for the party and provided table ware for the birthday cake.

Adnan was very attentive, making sure the whole time that we were well taken care of.   I had a great party and all my friends who attended had only great things to say about the place.  I will definitely come back here.  Thanks again for a great time.
author: c h.

description:
I hesitate to write this review for fear that too many people will know about this little neighborhood bar and I will lose my seat at that bar but can you say YAY! This place is awesome!!! Love. Love. Love this place. Great additional to the Richmond. 

It's great atmosphere and not at all pretentious. Adnad and Gwyn are awesome. Someone in a review said it is a bit pricey, but they let you taste any of the wines before they pour and the pours are good pours.

The small plates are really great too and complement the wines. 

The space is great with a mix of small tables, a long center table and bar seating. It also doesn't get too loud so easy to have conversation. Great with groups or for a romantic date. 

Anyway, I can't say enough about this place!
author: Mary D.

description:
Internos Wine Cafe is a welcome addition to the neighborhood for a nice outing with girlfriends or hubby, very different from the divey bars on Clement & Geary. They don't do flights but we were able to taste a few wines which help us pick a bottle. They have a good selection of small plates that keep you sated. I had the Bruchetta with Hummus /Avocado and my friend had the Bruchetta with ham & goat cheese - both very yummy.
I was not fond of the seating against the wall couldn't figure out a comfortable position but the large table in the middle worked out well. They have room to sit & sip or stand & sip, which is nice.
author: Anu Y.

description:
Finally, a wine bar that isn't stuffy. This place has bulldozed to the top of my hang out list. The interior decor is a 10. My jaw dropped when I learned that one of the owners built everything himself, from the floor to the tables?!  

Their menu selection consists of wine by the glass, or bottle, and small bites. The wine list is enticing!  Many of the wines they offer are rare so prepare yourself to experience something new.
author: Nico L.

description: We recently held a book party here, and it was the perfect venue, a glamorous, intimate place that worked even when we had 40 people in the room. The staff could not have been more gracious. We had a cash bar, and hosted the food, and Internos presented a gorgeous spread of appetizers, and everything flowed beautifully, without a hitch. We'll be back. I'm a little chuffed seeing the negatives below--write them off as crazy yelp cruft, because this place is magically delicious.
author: Hillary J.

description: I went to Internos to have a great time, I was there with a group of  ladies and was completely shocked, and disappointed when the service was extremely unprofessional, rude and far from hospitable. I have passed the word along to my friends, colleagues and family to avoid the place like the plague.
author: c m.

description: Such a neighborhood gem! Great wine selection. I like that it varies and that I can always walk in and try something new. Love the lighting and atmosphere. The artwork isn't always my taste, but again, its nice that it's always different. Excellent service and company. Fun for a date or after work drink spot. I wish they stayed open later some nights, but this neighborhood closes up pretty early regardless.
author: jon s.

description: wow, had planned a great night with friends.  so much potential....cute place.  unfortunately  one of the owners is a total troll and got super moody with some  of the patrons and completely ruined the vibe.  i mean seriously he just lost it over nothing.  in fact i believe he felt the people were laughing too loud.   it wasn't even 8pm and he was already uptight and considering the mediocre crowd........well I say skip it.  seriously you can find much more fun other places.  try g bar or something.  he just ruined the night......who needs it.
author: colleen d.

description: This place has been open about two weeks now.  I first saw it being built-out about a month ago.  At that time, I thought what a great addition to the neighborhood.  There are quite a few bars on Geary, but how many of them are classy?  Really???    Internos has a great warmth to it.  From the moment you walk in the door, the vibe hits you- The bar staff is friendly, knowledgeable and attentive too.  We only bought a couple of drinks, but even so- we were offered a free top-off.  And I must say, as a rookie oenophile, I did appreciate the knowledge the host offered us.  The two wines we had were pretty tasty and I left there with the thought in my head: "I'm definitely coming back".     Good luck Internos!  or should I say Salute!
author: Shawn C.

description: SO thrilled to have this around the corner from our house!  Just what the neighborhood needed and if only there were more quaint, intimate bars in Laurel Heights. The bruscetta was delicious as were the beets.  Great wine selection and my husband was happy to see 3 IPA's on the beer board.  We will be regulars for sure!
author: Marina A.

description: Garbage.  No good.  One friggin bartender on friday night pouring skimpy 3oz glasses of wine at $13 a pop.  Go to calmart, buy two bottles of $12 wine and enjoy your night.  Shameful.
author: Freakishly M.

description: This is a great, laid-back wine bar with very cool owners.  I live in the hood and have been there a bunch of times.  Regarding all these crazy posts - I was NOT there that night, but my guess is that most of the posters were not either.  I have no clue what actually happened - but I do know this: Adnan & Quinn are GOOD PEOPLE.  Please don't let any of the ridiculous posts dissuade you from checking this place out (or returning).  It's a really great find.
author: S R.

description: Me and my guy went here last night as the first stop of a friend's engagement party. It is small, dark, and cozy with a full size window out front that looks out on Geary. The decor is rustic and warm, with local art on the walls (for sale of course) and a great filament bulb chandelier hanging above the communal table. While I enjoyed the ambiance and the company, the most important part of the wine bar - the wine - was not so great. I don't have the most developed palate in the world but I didn't love either of the two glasses I had. The wines by the glass was a pretty short list, with multiple selections (at least 6) covered by little red stickers due to unavailability. Wine unavailable at a wine bar struck me as kind of odd. Either they need to reprint the menu or restock because that just seemed tacky. Also they had a selection of specialty beers as listed on a chalkboard under a T.V playing sports (still wondering about the sports at a wine bar thing). The beer seemed like somewhat of an afterthought and possibly a result of their skimpy by the glass selection? While the pours were quite generous I think they need to step it up in the by the glass offerings.
author: Vanessa M.

description: This is definitely one the best additions to the Inner Richmond. The staff is friendly, helpful and always make you feel at home.
author: Christopher C.

description: Great wine bar with friendly unassuming staff. International wine selections and some reasonably priced values. If you are in the mood to splurge there are some beauties in the 13 dollar range. Nothing over 20 dollars. And there are always a couple glasses in the 8 dollar range. I have never considered it a pricey place to go for what you get. I consider my habit of drinking wine in restaurants a pricey one, but most wine worth drinking is expensive. Great happy hour from 4 to 8 with 2 dollars off all wine by the glass and 3 dollar draft beers. Cozy up to the bar, enjoy some friendly conversation, and the free bar nuts ( yummy). Also, the meat and cheese plate is great with 2 large portions of cheese and huge piles of prosciutto and another cured meat for a great deal! My boyfriend and I love this place and go here all the time.
author: Heather H.

description: internos is a comfortable neighborhood wine cafe that doesn't have the pretentious overlay like other sf wine bars (can you say terrior?!)... the owners/staff are agreeable and knowledgeable about their wines, and the interior with its heavy wooden decor reminds me of some of the tapas bars that i frequented when i lived in barcelona... with the specials in the early part of the week, who can go wrong?! i really like this place.
author: sundari f.

description: This wine bar is really cool and low-key.  It's one of my favorite in the city.  And the bartender is awesome!
author: Allie Y.

description: For a neighborhood wine bar, it doesn't get much better than this! Internos is right around the corner from my apartment, yet last week was my first trip there after a former colleague's recommendation. Adnan set us up with two wonderful wines and a full plate of nuts, olives and chocolates to go with it. It capped off a perfect night for entertaining an out of town guest.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Our second time to Internos and it was just as outstanding as our first visit. A quiet Sunday evening, a group of four, and some great wine from off the beaten track - we sampled wines from Spain, Greece, and Argentina, as well as more familiar regions of the US, France, and Australia. Totally unpretentious, great/friendly/knowledgeable service.  Highly recommended!
author: Walter A.

description: Let's think about this...  Adnan is an entrepreneur / business owner.   He works just like the rest of us to make a living.  I don't know Adnan very well, but I really enjoy his bar, wines, food, atmosphere, and service, and I would bet that his business plan is to create a warm and pleasant environment for his customer so he can benefit from repeat business and make the bar profitable - pretty simple math.  With that said, no business owner would turn down business, or create adverse publicity around their business unless it was for a just cause.  I appreciate that Adnan did not want to subject his paying customers to viewing another couple takeing their clothes off in the middle of his establishment.  This is not a discriminatory issue, it's simple business acumen.  I really enjoy Internos, it's a hip, fun, and relaxed place to drink fantastic wines any day after work - I hope to enjoy a glass with everyone next time I'm there!
author: Chalene C.

description: I wish I thought of this first!  This neighborhood needed a wine bar and I think Internos is great.  I went here for drinks on a Saturday.  We got a table and it was busy but not crowded.  I enjoyed it and thought the wine list was pretty decent.  I am looking forward to going back.
author: Marie N.

description: Loved it - tasty wine with generous pours,  great recommendations from helpful and friendly staff - my only problem was the music!  Bon Jovi and Bob Marley , they need a new playlist and then I would bump it up to 5 stars.  A great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Niccole B.

description: Very welcome addition to the Inner Richmond.  My husband and I went last night and really enjoyed the experience. Nicely crafted wine list, with some eclectic, fun selections.  It's not an overwhelmingly long list, which I like.  Friendly, welcoming staff.  We sampled a few small plates and everything was tasty.  Be prepared for the noise when it's full.  Lots of hard surfaces and high ceilings = hard to hear your date when it's crowded.  We are looking forward to returning in the late afternoon when it's not so full.
author: A W.
